column6: Works Great to Stop Poison Ivy and Poison Sumac after contact.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020
column14: I used this product while I was clearing a section of my property that had substantial poison ivy and poison sumac.  Because this product removes oils it stops the start and spreading of these plants. I used it directly after being exposed and daily for a few days and never had more than a couple of little spots. It also helps stop the itching. This product works as good or better than Zanfel which cost $40.00 for 2 ounces.

column6: Works very well for me, a car/motorcycle hobbyist.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
column14: This stuff sure works for me.  I am an old car and motorcycle enthusiast.  I do ALL my own maintenance and repairs ---big repairs sometimes.  I've used Orange cleaner with pumice.  It's been good, BUT I found this is MUCH more effective.  I was skeptical of "dirt infused", but no longer.  The hardest grime to clean off hands is the grime that becomes embedded after repeated hand washings.  You know...you get grimy,, clean, get grimy again, clean, repeat.  Each time the grime becomes more firmly part of your skin.  I should wear gloves more often but I just like the feel for the work when I use my bare hands.  I pay for it when it comes time to clean my hands.  THIS STUFF WORKS REGARDLESS.  I was surprised.  Anyway, you can see I'm sold on it.  Rather expensive, but you get what you pay for in this case.  I've had no problem with it being too thick to pump or clogging my sink, as a few reviews have indicated.  I will note that if you do not rinse it off very well, it leaves some kind of residue.  It feels a bit like hand lotion left on your hands, which sounds like a good thing, but I found it a bit too potent smelling if, say, you are going to work on food preparation.  So, rinse well!

column6: Not nearly as good as the reviews by others.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
column14: For starters I am a professional auto technician, as such I wash my hands in excess of 20X a day. My shop has always used Gojo "Original Pumice" which we were happy with. My nephew saw a video about this hand cleaner and asked if we would buy for the shop for the guys to try. This hand cleaner takes a significant amount of water to use, and, has left all four guys with dry cracked hands. In addition it takes significantly longer to wash our hands and the cleaning action pales in comparison to the Gojo we are accustomed to using, It is also significantly more expensive than the Gojo product. This product will not be bought again. I wonder why/how others have rated this product so highly. Do they work on greasy cars for a living? Or, have they ever used a hand cleaner that actually cleans their hands well? Something about these reviews with 5 starts is not right...

column14: I really wanted to like this product. Besides the body wash, I bought the bar soap and antiperspirant, all in the Extra Fresh scent. The soap is not too bad, but it melts very quickly. The antiperspirant is good but read below. I have 3 problems with this body wash. I use a large loofa in the shower. This stuff makes hardly any foam or suds, even when using a lot! I used other body washes from Nivea and Bath & Body Works that explode with suds using only a dollop. Not this stuff! Maybe a washcloth would work better, but I love my loofa.  I know that scent is very subjective. The smell is nice but a little overpowering. However, it fades pretty quickly and becomes acceptable. The biggest problem that I had with this body wash was that it doesn't really clean! Even after scrubbing with a loofa, I could still feel the residue from my Dove antiperspirant under my arms! I had to use the bar soap to get the stickiness off. I will try using some full-strength body wash under each arm first and see if that makes any difference. Won't be buying any more Dove body wash.

column6: Dr Bronner's does it all, and does it right.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018
column14: Dr. Bronner's is like a magical potion, it does it all. It's not as thick as I thought it would be, but it's very concentrated - doesn't take much to do the job. It can also dry my face out if I'm using it too much, so I try not to wash my face with it every day. But overall highly recommended!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
column14: I'm a man in my 50's and I never thought I'd have to use any special soap ...just so it was soap. I tried lotions that my wife bought but I just didn't like the creamy, oily feeling on my hands and my body.  It could've been the soap we were using that were strong scented soaps.  I've used Colloidal Silver for inner ear infections (swimmers ear) and even for my sinuses and it worked great so I thought I'd give this a try.  It seemed like it took several showers with it in order to start to notice a difference but I stopped itching.  It didn't leave a greasy, lotiony type feeling on me either.  I just felt clean.  It lathers up real good ...lots of foam.  So if you're a man that doesn't want to smell like you were thrown into a bath tub of rose perfume this is an option because it doesn't really leave a scent.  You just smell clean and that's what I wanted.

column14: I have used Dove products, especially Dove bar soap for over 30 years, even use it to wash my face. I cannot believe the prices on some items sold on Amazon and I can't see anyone paying almost $100 for a couple of bottles of cleaning solution, etc.  which sells for a tenth of the price in stores or online from retailers. I think the soap is extremely reasonably priced given the size of the bar and its exceptional quality. The wonderful scent makes a daily shower or bath something to anticipate! I can also say that, after using it for just a week, I could not believe how much softer and less dry my skin was. It seems that every time I use the soap my skin is in better conditioner than the day before, as though the effects of this lovely soap are cumulative. column14: This is my first time trying matted lipstick, but it's not really a lipstick in the sense of its shape, but it is rather a matted lip gloss since it has a wand. It was a little hard for me using a wand because my hand is not as steady so I prefer actual lipstick. The nicest looking picture is #3 Jinx (my favorite of the bunch), the next is #14 Berry Me, and lastly #13 Fwtish. The only issue I had was with #4 since it went on a little patchy and you can tell in the photo. I did not wear these all day, but I have a feeling they will last because they're pretty tough to get off. Be prepared to have some coconut oil or some other oil based makeup remover because that's what works best/fastest. As for the matted aspect they all dried very nicely (see #13, they all ended like that but the other 2 I took a little premature so it looks wet). Overall they don't have any overwhelming scents and I really enjoyed this as my first matted lip wear!

column14: This is definitely one of the better liquid lipsticks I have tried by far.  I've been trying out so many of them since wearing a mask.  Most of them are awful-very drying and/or cakey, wear off too soon, all sort of problems.  This one is very nice.  I don't find it too drying, I won't go as far as to say that is not drying at all, it is slightly so, but not bad.  It wears very, very well, and I don't get a lot of caking on the inner lip with it.  It wears a long time, and I get very little to none wearing off on my mask.  I bought 006, Eyes on You, which is a nice medium neutral brown-but-not-too-brown, it has enough of a pink or some undertone to it to keep it from being brown.  And I have 009, Speak Up, which is a medium neutral pinky mauve, not Barbie or bubblegum pink by any means, just a neutral pink leaning warmer.  Both are very easy to wear shades that could be called Neutral shades to wear easily with most things.  I am sold on this formula, they did well with this.

column6: Blissed out and fatal apple - gorgeous and perfect for everyday!!!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
column14: These are just so so perfect! They feel exactly like a liquid lip balm. Not at all overly glossy, reflective, or glass-like, which is why I strayed away from glosses many times. These are just great!!! I love them! They can definitely be used in a professional setting. Don't be afraid about any opaque pigment issues with these shades. They go on very sheer and balmy with a sort of clear, gel-like base. Fatal apple is exactly like a clear red that reads as a sheer, clear red-pink (DUPE FOR GLOSSIER 'RED'). Blissed out is a perfect sheer warm, clear-pink with gorgeous shimmers that is not at all over the top (DUPE FOR FENTY 'FU$$Y'), and it will definitely work on many skin tones because it doesn't have any opaque color. It is like a clear pink gel with tiny shimmers. You can only see the shimmers if you examine your lips up close with a mirror. Otherwise from even a short distance, it just looks like you're wearing a slightly reflective lip balm. So so so good. I 100% plan on repurchasing after I finish. These are my new faves!!!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
column14: I have been on an absolute mission to find a lipstick, stain or color that simply stays put once on.  MANY promise this ... w/ 'smudge proof' or 'transfer proof' or w/ names like lip tattoo. However, I have yet to find that one that truly holds up to drinking, eating, and just generally going thru out your day w/ out having to reapply nor worry about looking ridiculous as part of it wears off (like the middle).  With this product, I even asked the community about long staying power w/ answers and verification it stays!  My experience is a resounding NO. It does the absolute usual- it does stay on possibly longer IF you don't eat drink normally. By normally I mean- after commute to work, the styrofoam coffee cup had lip prints on it. After eating lunch ( a Lean Cuisine pasta) I had to totally reapply as all that was left was bits in the middle of my lips. Out to dinner w/ friends, it, sure enough, wore off sipping wine :(.  Wiping mouth? Yup- appeared on the napkin. Sigh....search continues.The 'nude' color was easy to apply and did have a pleasant, almost slightly mint? flavor, but to me looked a little pink for a natural look.  Overall, yet another product that is nice, but certainly does NOT deliver that long lasting color as promised unless, hmmmm...you do little talking, eating or drinking and don't use a napkin. Needless to say, I most certainly exfoliate lips, use a lip pencil first, and let it "dry" beyond the recommended time :(

column14: The IGK Legendary Dream Shampoo was simply not legendary nor dreamy.  This was an average shampoo that didn't perform any better than most drugstore shampoos and that had a scent that smelled more like cheap cologne than anything.  The creamy white shampoo lathered up well, rinsed out easily, and left my hair feeling slightly stripped after use.  This is definitely a shampoo you will need to use with a conditioner as it will leave your hair feeling dry and staticky afterward.  The thing that bothered me the most about this shampoo was the scent - it simply didn't smell good.  The shampoo had a distinctive woody perfume scent to it.  It actually reminded me of those old medicinal Chinese soaps that my grandparents had decades ago - while it was nostalgic, it wasn't in a pleasant way.  At the current price, this shampoo was neither unique nor good enough for me to want to get again.  There are many other premium shampoos available on Amazon - this one was sadly a pass for me.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2017
column14: Amazon does not list the ingredients in the product when you place the order. Caveat Emptor-Let The Buyer Beware.  The problem is that the product contains mineral oil and petroletum oil.  Mineral oil is actually a by-product in the processing of gasoline from petroletum and molecules of the mineral oil are too large to even pass through pores of the skin and will only sit on top of your skin "sealing in" the germs and suffocating your skin from moisture, as well as cutting off precious oxygen and preventing toxins from escaping the skin, that can cause acne. Mineral oil is simply a cheap filler 80% of companies use to help increase their products regardless of the harmful effects to your skin and health. Petroleum is a crude oil found beneath the ground and refined to produce fuels including gasoline, kerosene, and diesel oil. When it is added to beauty products (primarily as a cheap filler), it makes that product comodogenic since it coats the skin and clogs the pores and does not, therefore allow moisture in, resulting in irritation, acne, skin dryness, and dandruff (if inside a hair care product). Do you really think that consumers want to wear toxic makeup that can cause damage?  I read the label when it arrived before I wore it.  That's how I found out these two chemicals were in it.  In the end, it's about safety not a refund!  There are organic lipsticks from very good makeup companies that list their ingredients and that's who I will buy my lipstick from.  It may cost more, but you can't place a price on your health.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020
column14: I bought this lipstick a few years ago (don't remember that....LOL)  & then just again purchased again recently.. I read online that it was a good "dupe" for a lipstick that I love  (Urban Decay BackTalk)  so I decided to give it a try..  First of all the color isn't a color that I would call a dupe or similar to the Urban Decay lipstick, it has more of a tan overall color/look to it which you can see more on my hand..  The BackTalk lipstick is more of a pink overtone which suits me better..  It might be hard to see in the pictures but the hand swatches are very different but of course colors come out different on the lips..  NEXT....  this lipstick lasts for a while, because its a matte one (few hours for me because I don't do much eating or drinking alot)  & I always find myself reapplying lipstick through the day anyway..  NEXT...  I didn't find this lipstick very moisturizing... My lips are usually very dry & I have to use a lip balm/lip conditioner  before I put on my lipstick & that helps the lipstick be a bit more moisturizing especially if its a matte one..  I like the matte lipsticks because they stay on a bit longer, don't usually find them very moisturizing..  If you're looking for moisturizing lipsticks them go for creamier lipsticks, those are usually good..

column6: So far so good for sensitive lips
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
column14: About 5 years ago, I began to develop an allergic reaction to lipstick.  I began to experience fine bumps and mild discomfort on my lower lip forcing me to just use products like vaseline or chapstick.  Every 6 - 8 months, I try a new brand of lip gloss and lipstick that claims to be good for sensitive lips, but by the 3rd day my lip would break out.  After taking another 6 month break, I decided to try this brand.  I am only on day 3, but I am happy to report that I am feeling no signs of irritation.  I love the color.  It comes on very rich.  It is almost matte like, so I am not finding that it is very moisterizing.  The color stays put for hours with limited eating and drinking.  I am hoping that my sensitive lips continue to behave.  I truly miss wearing lipstick and would love to try more colors.  I am feeling very hopeful about this product because all of the others that I have tried caused problems right away.

column6: there aren't good instructions on the Gabriel site
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2015
column14: I read the reviews here and other sites trying to figure out how to get this primer right; there aren't good instructions on the Gabriel site.  I have never used lipstick regularly before and I wanted to learn how to get smudgeless deep color lips.  It took me about 2 weeks of trial and error to get it right, and still not 100%.  Use your finger to put a thin layer of primer on; a brush applies too much and not as evenly.  Do not rub lips together, let it dry/set for about 3 minutes.  Then apply a thin layer of lipstick and let it set.  If you see primer on your lipstick, the primer was not set and may have been too heavy a layer, so wipe off and start over.  After the first layer of lipstick is set, a few minutes, you can apply another thin layer of lipstick.  The primer does help keep it set, but you still have to reapply after a meal.

column6: Zero staying power, overwhelmingly fruity scent
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2017
column14: I bought this in Desert, and I don't understand why people say it's so pigmented -- I have to swipe it three or four times across my mouth to see any significant color.  It comes off immediately on anything your mouth touches be it a straw, a glass, food, skin.  If you're careful not to touch, it comes off anyway within an hour or so just from normal lip movement and friction.  And it smells very strongly of a fruity mango scent that I don't care for; I don't smell any vanilla at all.  Just a sickly sweet fruit scent.  I gave it two stars instead of one because disliking the scent is my personal preference, and it's a decent gloss. Just expect to layer it over a longer-lasting product, or reapply every 20 minutes.

column6: My long search for the perfect nude lipstick is over

column6: This is an awesomely cool shade if your skin is cool toned

column14: This is an incredibly unique shade that borders on a grayish purple but it‚Äôs such a cool grungy look for any age person. This is a unique shade that is a combo of gray/violet and brown.  But it‚Äôs not a really really cool toned brown and it‚Äôs not gray either.  It has just enough purple to be super flattering on my cool toned skin.  It wears ‚Äúpretty‚Äù well, not the best and not the worst.  I wish it was a truly matte formula since those have a much longer wear time, no matter the brand.  I wish someone (smart) on the Loreal lipstick team would make a proposal to just take out the perfume.  No one WANTS perfume in their lipsticks.  Yes, some can live with it and are fine if there is perfume, but honesty, I don‚Äôt know a single person that would honestly say ‚Äúoh yeah, gotta have perfume in this, no doubt about it.‚Äù

I decided to take the plunge and splurge on a couple of bottles of Pantene, and oh boy, I couldn't have been happier. I look like a new man! My wife even tried to come back, but I told her to get lost. My children were so surprised and elated, even they wanted to spend time with me, but I said no thanks hombres. I'm a new man, a better man...and so, I needed a better family! If you're like me, you'll appreciate everything this shampoo can do for you.

column6: I had to venture away from the liquid formula lipsticks for summer and this is a perfect choice!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2018
column14: I am and always have been a liquid lipstick kind if girl but the other day I realized I was going to have to venture out and experiment with done lighter formulas because my summer eyeshadow palettes bought so far are more matched with a lipstick not as bold and deep looking as a liquid matte.  First I bought a few from Loreal Riche color shine line and I fell in love so I wanted something along the lines of that without the hi shine finish so i can switch it up a bit throughout summer.  This lipstick is my answer.  I love the formula...feels soft and comfortable...not dry.  I ordered 2 colors to start and this is the 1st I received.  The pictures are definitely deceiving add to the color.  And being fair skinned, Iv have to be careful because it doesn't take much for a shade to look to dark out bright on me. When I opened this, I was convinced it was going to be way to dark but when I applied it, I was pleased to see that it's not as opaque as I thought and i was able to sheet it or across my lips and the end result was very flattering.  With a pop of gloss in the center...I was left wondering why it had taken me so long to discover such a pretty, comfortable lipstick.  People complain about having to reapply but you should know before you purchase a creamy lipsticklike this that it is an inevitable part of wearing t his kind if formula.  I don't mind doing it...it takes 2 seconds and my lips always look freshly applied.  Well be buying more shades

column6: A great lipstick and a great color!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2015
column14: I saw this product used on Emma Stone at the Oscars and thought she looked wonderful. This is more of a coral while still having an orange tint--it is exactly what I was looking for color-wise.  I especially love the texture and low-shine of this lipstick.  There is still a little shine, but I'd call it more of a satin.  Less shine looks better on women my age (early 50's).  I would suggest going to Revlon's site to review the colors if you don't know what color to purchase, or check it out at a store if you have any questions about color.  I'm very happy with the quality and color of this lipstick.  As far as the cost--I probably could have found this much cheaper in a local store, but I'm disabled and have a hard time getting out, so I was willing to pay a bit more for the convenience of delivery.  I do think this lipstick is as high in quality as some designer/department store brands.  Well done, Revlon.

column14: I have long, fine hair that I keep up with light styling. Usually I‚Äôm careful about hair products because my hair can weigh down easily. But recently, I had an issue with hair breakage. My strands would seem to snap, leaving little hair pieces in my sink, on my brush, etc. and making my hair look frizzy. My hair stylist recommended a VERY expensive hair care line, which admittedly worked but I did not want to spend so extravagantly on shampoo and conditioner. Then this Dove line came out, so I tried it. Thank God! Not only do I no longer have the breakage problem, my hair feels stronger and improved for a lot less money than the expensive salon line. The breakage problem is gone! This shampoo and conditioner do not weigh down my fine hair and I‚Äôve used them faithfully for several months now. I was excited to see these large bottles available and have them parked in the shower. These products really work for me, and I‚Äôd recommend anyone with hair breakage to try them out.

The fullness is very refreshing and natural.  This shampoo smells very nice and lathers up very easily.  With other shampoos I would feel build-up over time but not with this.  I also appreciate the savings buying it in large volume like here.  But what I do not appreciate it that even when purchased from Amazon themselves as I made sure to do this time the large bottle arrived with some of the shampoo leaking out the top.  It was all over the bottle and a pain to wash off but overall a minimal amount though no amount should be the correct amount.  But the shampoo itself will indeed add volume in a natural way to fine and thinning hair.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
column14: I have a lot of hair on my head, but the individual strands are very fine and so I struggle with frizz and little volume. One day my stylist used the Paul Mitchell special shampoo and conditioner on me at the salon and I found myself totally in love with the smell and the way the it made my scalp tingle... And once my hair was dried and styled, I was excited to see some oomph despite the stylist not using any other volumizing products. When I asked her about it I was expecting her to tell me that it was one of the usual high end products that are normally used at salons- you know, the ones that cost like $50 a bottle- but was thrilled to learn how inexpensive they are despite their good quality. Needless to say, I ended up leaving the salon with a couple of bottles and it's been my standard shampoo/conditioner ever since. I have tried other products over the years, such as specialty shampoos that promise to improve strength, growth, and volume, but I always find myself going back to this. I really do feel that my hair is healthier and grows more quickly because of it. I also love this brand because there are several different types and scents To choose from (not sure if they are all technically part of the "special" line, but they do come in the same little green bottles, unlike the other Paul Mitchell products) and I've enjoyed playing around with different combinations. Currently my favorite combo is the lemon sage shampoo with the lavender mint conditioner (although I do still love the tea tree shampoo as well). I've been using these products for about 5 years now and I plan to continue using them so long as they stay available and affordable. And I absolutely recommend them to anyone with fine, flat hair like mine!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2022
column14: I have very fine hair, I have my whole life. Over the last few years, it has begun to thin gradually. Nothing crazy, but over time its lost some of its volume. Not to a point that a nice wash with a good shampoo wouldn't be able to hide any noticeable lack of coverage. I've used Organix (OGX) biotin shampoo, Avalon Organics biotin etc. and was happy with both. Nothing but typical couple loose hairs while shampooing or a few loose hairs when brushing afterwards. I was running low and decided to give this biotin a try seeing it had added claims such as DHT blocking properties.  I cannot regret that decision more. After a couple weeks of using this product my hair began falling out in clumps and my scalp became extremely itchy and flaky. Its typical for anyone to lose up to 100 hairs a day but this lead to over 100 per wash and every brush. I'd brush in the afternoon to check if it was still happening when dry and I'd lose even more. All I had to do was run a flat hand down my head and I'd be picking up 50 or more hairs out of the sink. I stopped immediately after realizing it had to be the shampoo. After a couple weeks of stopping with the shampoo the constant extreme itching has stopped and the flakes have lessened significantly but the hair fall is still more than I've ever experienced at any other time in my life. Its gotten to a point that you can see scalp all over my head, sides, back top everything.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
column14: First, some background: I am a female, 22, and I started buying professional shampoo after experiencing hormonal changes and living in an area of China with very polluted water and air caused my hair to dramatically change structure, fall out, and be so brittle that I could not brush it or it would break and fall out in pieces. I bought this product along with the corresponding conditioner upon recommendation from my hairstylist, and at first I thought it was a miracle, because it made my hair so soft and sleek. I was so excited, and spent $60 bucks on more of it after I used my first order. However- around the 6 month mark, I noticed my scalp was flaking more than usual. I chalked it up to winter weather, and ignored it - until I started noticing scabby patches appearing under my hair. I could not understand what was causing it, and tried discontinuing leave in conditioners, and changing pillowcases and diet- but nothing worked. The final straw was when my follicles started detaching: hair would drift down from my head in the middle of the day and I would see it on my shirts or in my car. It was awful- and then when I was reordering this shampoo, I noticed one of the one star reviews ALSO mentioned hair loss and dry scalp. I stopped using it and my scalp healed by the next week, and my hair loss has stopped over the last month. I switched to Garnier triple nutrition and that works way better with no irritation, and costs $7 at Target. So I would not recommend this- I spent $120 prolonging my hair recovery journey.

If you have acne I would suggest looking up this product and Vaseline uses as well, worked for me. Hopefully my routine continues to work. If it doesn't I will update!

The smaller bottle of the exact same shampoo I purchased at Target does not small bad, it smells like it always has over the years, a soft pleasant fragrance, it‚Äôs thinner a thinner consistency that I‚Äôm used too & is a pearly golden translucent coloring, again what I‚Äôve seen over the last several years using this product. column6: Yes, it can turn your hair lavender!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2018
column14: Since May 2018, 5+mos, I have only used this shampoo & conditioner which has turned the under layers of my shoulder length hair lavender. I bought it in hopes of changing the outermost layer from a light blonde back to silver which hasn't happened. I don't know why some of my hair turned blonde--regular shampoo, leave-in hair products to keep my very thick unruly hair tame, or too much sun except I always wear a hat? It used to be very dark chestnut brown in my youth (never blonde). I never died my hair, it started changing to salt & pepper in my early 30s, now more salt than pepper in my early 60s. Strangers, even hair dressers, told me how beautiful my hair color was, I could trust them over family/friends :-)  Six yrs ago my hairdresser helped me grow it out from a very short style and suggested shampoo for silver hair which I never tried until this. I've been thinking if it was still short, cut regularly, this lavender tinting wouldn't have happened, but just today I noticed an attractive woman with almost white short hair and could see a slight tint of lavender to it! I asked my husband if I was imagining it, he said no, he saw it too. From what others have reviewed this doesn't happen to everyone but it can happen! I've now tossed this shampoo & conditioner and have bought a shampoo for blonde hair promising to make it two shades lighter in hopes it might remove the lavender and the blonde from my hair. I just hope like one reviewer mentioned that it doesn't turn green! I may have to have it cut very short again and start over. Of course these days any color, every color, seems to be in :-) It's amazing that young women are dying their hair to look grey which usually has a lavender or blue tint to it.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
column14: My goal for this product was to achieve hair growth which may not be your primary motivation. About two years ago I noticed that my hair was thinning badly. I‚Äôm going to be 58 next month and I have left  what used to constitute One pigtail that‚Äôs now a single ponytail.  . I had the classic male pattern thinning above my temples and with my bangs. I was completely freaking out as my hair is kind of my signature feature. It‚Äôs always been wavy and fine but pretty. I also let my silver grow out about four years ago and the lack of processing has made my hair healthy,  shiny and soft. At the end of 2018 I embarked on this research project about how to re-grow my hair and keep what I have from hair care products, the way that I treat my hair,  and nutrition. They said not to keep your hair tightly wrapped up and to let it flow, that washing your hair every other day was better because it removes buildup on the scalp, so I dumped the Pantene and tried the biotin shampoo starting two years ago. At the same time I start Taking the 5000 mg of biotin pills for hair and nails from natures bounty that I got at Costco. And at the beginning of 2019 I research which vitamins and foods to eat which include anything high in vitamin A like red and yellow bell peppers, red cabbage, spinach, Sweet potatoes, Butternut squash and cauliflower‚Ä¶ along with almonds sunflower seeds salmon eggs and Greek yogurt.  I bough this Nizoral In April 2019. As of today I have an entire undercoat of fine new hair but it‚Äôs only about 4 inches which leads me to believe that the biotin shampoo really didn‚Äôt affect things all that much. Four Inches of hair growth is about 8 months. So I went back on to Amazon to see you when I first bought this  dandruff shampoo and lo and behold it was in April which is eight months today - January 1, 2021. I do believe that nutrition is key along with stress management and sleep course. But I find it really interesting that I‚Äôm able to trace the number of inches to when I bought this shampoo.  I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs 100% direct correlation but I can testify that is working for me in the hair growth department. I also found a different hair growth vitamin that I‚Äôm going to start using next week.  It‚Äôs called Hair La Vie.  Last observation. I did use Nioxin 3  for a number of years and I don‚Äôt think it worked as well as the shampoo coupled with the nutrition. Because I still had a lot of hair thinning of the temples which is now filling in considerably. And also Nioxin dries your hair out badly. I like alternating between the biotin shampoo and this dandruff shampoo because the Biotin Shampoo is less drying than Nizoral.  The key is to get it worked up into your scalp really well and just let it sit there for a while so you have to like use it less often. I hope this helps you I know How agonizing it is to lose your hair especially when you‚Äôre a woman. Good luck

column6: Looking for something to help with greasy, color treated hair? You found it.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
column14: I have been excited to leave a review for this product! I dye my hair but unfortunately have a greasy scalp. It's hard to find a shampoo that helps greasy hair that is color treated. THIS IS IT. My color doesn't fall out and it helps with greasy hair! Obviously, there is no product that can completely eliminate the problem of having greasy hair. It's important to have realistic expectations. Try using this product for a month and then evaluate your results. I still need to use dry shampoo, but I have tried a lot of products and have found nothing better than this. It's also important to follow the instructions. Massage slowly into scalp and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Repeat process. You must do this process twice or you will not see the results you're looking for. You'll notice the first time you put it in, there will be little to no foam/soap. The second time, you'll see LOTS of foam/soap. This is how you know it's working! All in all, I think this is great product to help greasy hair and to maintain your color.

column6: More hair loss compared to regular shampoo
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
column14: I am going to write this review for both the coconut wow shampoo and the acv shampoo by wow since I have used both and my oldest has tried the acv. (1) I have no idea if this is supposed to for all hair types. It isn't. (2) In 2016 my husband and I went through a stressful time with a company - not wow - that ruined my stress level and caused my hair to thin out more than what it already was. When dealing with that company was done with, my hair was not thinning out as much and i wanted to try and get new hair growing in and work in decreasing hair falling out. I tried the wow acv and I noticed more hair was coming out than regular shampoo. I read it was not really for helping hair to grow back so I stopped. However, my oldest, who had incredible thick hair, used it because she loved the smell of it. She stopped using it after a month, but never said why until recently. Will get to that in a bit. (2) I started using the wow coconut to help with stimulating hair growth. THe hair loss was the same for women my age with thin hair. early 40's it happens but was not that bad at all. I only wanted to stimulate the hair growth where it was showing thinness in some areas. I used the wow coconut the first time. 3-4 times the hair came out than with regular shampoo. I used regular shampoo the next time. the usual 5-15 strands of hair would come out. I would hten use the coconut. 3-4 times the hair comes out than with regular shampoo. I emailed wow and they said not to use any other shampoo and to only use theirs to be effective. I then washed my hair with wow coconut and 3-4 times the hair came out than with regular shampoo. didn't wash it for 2 days. used coconut wow shampoo again, 3-4 times the hair came out. waited another two days before washing my hair again. I was nervous to use it again, but decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. washed it and sure enough. 3-4 times the hair loss from regular shampoo. I know everyone loses on average 100 strands of hair a day, but this was insane. I then decided I was done and I needed to find the shampoo that did work for stimulating hair growth and did work (the only reason I stopped that one was because the peppermint was so strong it made me lightheaded, but I would rather wash my hair in the kitchen sink and endure the strong peppermint and have a product that works then lose hair with wow). I had asked my oldest who used the wow acv if she still uses it. she said no. I asked her why because I was curious if it was causing her beautiful think hair to thin out and it thinned out a lot. she flat out said she stopped using it because of all the hair that was falling out when she used it. She went from having to have her hair thinned out every 2-3 months with a pile that looked like a small bunny to having thin hair. This only happened when she used the wow. She said when she uses anything but wow, she has no problems with hair falling out. I don't know why the wow coconut and acv shampoos made our hair fall out, I was really having hopes with all the reviews, but there is nothing wrong with either of us for our hair to be falling out like this. Again, it only falls out 3-4 more when we use the wow coconut and acv. If we use suave, tressemme, herbal essence, we do not have an issue at all. We have the normal amount fall out that we have our entire lives that is common for everyone. I will be seeing if I can return it since it is in the time frame. I want to keep my hair. Not have it thin out 3-4 times faster than what it normally would have.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
column14: I have been using the Tea Tree Lemon Sage Thickening shampoo and conditioner for years now.  My hair stylist first recommended it and it has worked really well on my fine and thin men's hair.  I think some get this thinking it is going to provide fuller and thicker hair that remains and does not go away.  Meaning it will over time provide permanently thicker hair.  That just is not possible.  What this does do with consistent use is after I wash with the shampoo and then use the conditioner is provide fuller and softer hair after each wash.  The fullness is very refreshing and natural.  This shampoo smells very nice and lathers up very easily.  With other shampoos I would feel build-up over time but not with this.  I also appreciate the savings buying it in large volume like here.  But what I do not appreciate it that even when purchased from Amazon themselves as I made sure to do this time the large bottle arrived with some of the shampoo leaking out the top.  It was all over the bottle and a pain to wash off but overall a minimal amount though no amount should be the correct amount.  But the shampoo itself will indeed add volume in a natural way to fine and thinning hair.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
column14: I have a lot of hair on my head, but the individual strands are very fine and so I struggle with frizz and little volume. One day my stylist used the Paul Mitchell special shampoo and conditioner on me at the salon and I found myself totally in love with the smell and the way the it made my scalp tingle... And once my hair was dried and styled, I was excited to see some oomph despite the stylist not using any other volumizing products. When I asked her about it I was expecting her to tell me that it was one of the usual high end products that are normally used at salons- you know, the ones that cost like $50 a bottle- but was thrilled to learn how inexpensive they are despite their good quality. Needless to say, I ended up leaving the salon with a couple of bottles and it's been my standard shampoo/conditioner ever since. I have tried other products over the years, such as specialty shampoos that promise to improve strength, growth, and volume, but I always find myself going back to this. I really do feel that my hair is healthier and grows more quickly because of it. I also love this brand because there are several different types and scents To choose from (not sure if they are all technically part of the "special" line, but they do come in the same little green bottles, unlike the other Paul Mitchell products) and I've enjoyed playing around with different combinations. Currently my favorite combo is the lemon sage shampoo with the lavender mint conditioner (although I do still love the tea tree shampoo as well). I've been using these products for about 5 years now and I plan to continue using them so long as they stay available and affordable. And I absolutely recommend them to anyone with fine, flat hair like mine!

Activated charcoal is soooo black that it stays black even with being diluted by other substances. I know because I have made some charcoal products of my own and was amazed at how persistent that black really is. This shampoo is a light grey. There is barely any charcoal. It smells nice and cleans well without stripping your hair or scalp. And is a product that I can feel good about buying, so it still gets 4 stars.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
column14: Many of the reviews state it does not cover small stubble or coarse hairs especially on the side of your temples. I realize from using hair dye in the past that it's the amount of time that is on your head that matters the most especially on the coarse hairs on the sides. The directions state only use it for a minute or two, you're not going to get any effect from it in any great way with such little time. From day one, after the allergy test, I started using it on my entire head for at least 10 minutes. Since we're in quarantine I have all the time in the world so I did this three times each day. My hair to start with was basically 60% Gray, fully noticeable. At the end of day three using it three times a day 10 minutes each time the top of my head which is longer was basically finished and looked perfect. But the sides still had very noticeable greys and I have my sides cut very short. I remember my barber would always leave the hair dye on much longer than recommended. I decided to see what would happen if I started to use it only on my sides for 20 minutes at a time. Bingo after two days three times per day I have even color throughout. Now I can use the maintenance dosage when needed which would probably only be once every two or three days. I realize not everyone has the time to do this three times per day but at least leave it on longer for about 20 to 30 minutes in the beginning..the results will come quickly and then you can get to your maintenance ASAP without having to worry about the stubborn course greys.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
column14: I am a woman in my mid forties who stopped coloring and highlighting my hair about 3 years ago.  After coloring and highlighting my thick, beautiful hair since the age of 17, having children, becoming older, my hair was a frizzy, brittle, product-needing, thinning mess.  I had to style my hair more and more and use more and more products to help it look nice.  I then started a new job and began working for an older woman who had the most incredible head of shiny and thick salt and pepper and silver hair.  I asked her what products she used and she said none.  She told me she washed and conditioned only.  She said the secret was to not color your hair and find a shampoo that kept your scalp healthy but didn't fry your hair.  She said, take care of your scalp so it is able to grow healthy hair, and don't abuse your hair once it has grown out.  It was such simple advice.  I stopped coloring and highlighting right then and there.  I won't lie.  It was rough at first and I felt ugly. The grow out was tough.  I did end up cutting it short once it had grown out a bit to get rid of all the processed fried hair.  I am glad I stuck with it, though.  Three years into my natural hair journey, my hair is healthy and shiny and growing like a weed.  I have light brown hair with an awesome silver streak on the top of my head.  That was another discovery, I had no idea what hair color I had.  Anyways, once my hair grew out, I wanted to invest in a shampoo that would promote a healthy scalp and nourish my hair.  This shampoo does the trick.  I no longer have dandruff and my hair is light and full of body without frizz.  And, after years of blow drying and using a straightener, I now wash my hair and let it air dry.  I have shiny, beach waves with lots of volume and no frizz.  This shampoo cleans my scalp so well but does not strip my hair.  I only have to wash my hair twice per week and it always looks good.  I have noticed that since I started using this shampoo, my scalp no longer itches and there is definitely less hair in the drain.

After turning to SLS free products, I was happy that I was giving my hair much needed TLC but none of the products made me fall in love with them because I couldn't see visible results (shiny, frizz-free, bouncy hair etc. as they usually promise) UNTIL I tried this one!  This curl shampoo enhances, like a curl cream or other styling product, and makes my wavy hair curly almost immediately- I wonder if it's the neem oil or hibiscus but the effect is darn visible! I love it because the look I get right after I shampoo and air dry my hair is natural, healthy, curly, and more tamed than other SLS products have gotten me. On a side note, my mom has been using Shea Moisture hair color and she swears by it too! Shea moisture seems like a reputed and effective brand because it's delivering results. column6: The Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner are amazing products
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
column14: I decided to order the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for severely damaged hair cause I was having a lot of hair breakage and shedding and I absolutely resented hair wash days. My hair was brittle and seemed always dry no matter what products I would put on it. I thought that I would have had to cut my hair and start completely over. However, when my products arrived, I could not wait to give them a try. I love the smells. Very nice and not powerful. I washed my hair twice with the Nexxus Shampoo, first time just the scalp, and the second wash, the hair itself. The way that my hair reacted to this shampoo was breathtaking! My curls appeared and believe it or not, I was able to pull a comb through my thick, natural, 4C  hair!! I have never, ever been able to do this before while washing. Barely any hair was coming out in my comb! I had not even used the conditioner yet. I just had to stop and look in the mirror and talk to myself saying, "Omg, I cannot believe this"! I have never, ever experienced a shampoo doing my hair like this before. After I completely rinsed the shampoo from my hair, I moved on to the Nexxus Conditioner. Even more amazing. It stated to leave on the hair for 3 min, but I sat under a hooded dryer for about 10min with the conditioner on my hair, under a plastic cap. Once my time was up, I rinsed away all of the conditioner. My hair was so manageable!! I was able to comb and section it to do my bantu knots and allow my hair to dry overnight. After washing my hair, it only took me about 30 min to get it  all done to dry. I have never been able to complete this process this quickly before! I am highly satisfied with these products! Even though they are  expensive products, I'm hooked and will be purchasing again. I told my mom about my experience and am ready to try it on her hair also, to see if she gets the same experience and satisfaction that I got. Thank you Nexxus for such wonderful products, and thank you Amazon for carrying them. Definitely a must try on the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for Severely damaged hair. This is my first time ever writing a review on a product. That's how pleased I was with these products!!

column6: Nope. Nope. Nope. NOT the replacement you are looking for!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2022
column14: The heartless,  greedy decision by Neutrogena to discontinue their anti-residue shampoo and promote their new line of products instead is simply devastating to those of us with sensitive scalps or conditions that require ZERO residue left behind. It takes a long time to rinse off, and I have thinning hair with a buzz cut! The old anti-residue shampoo was rated high and a best seller. They figure a shelf full of bottles with pretty colors and nonsense like "micellar water" or grapefruit is going to entice people to try new ones over and over. Neutrogena identifies as a company that cares about your skin - it's a lie. They care about their bottom line. What they've done is unforgivable, really. And yet, I'd have no choice to buy the anti-residue shampoo that I've been using for nearly 40 years if they come to their senses and bring it back - unless another company comes up with a product to replace what we want - then I will surely never buy from Neutrogena again. I will, however, never buy ANY other Neutrogena product for any reason. I drove all over town to find the very last bottles on the shelves after learning they discontinued it. I spent a fortune. I can't believe they are trying to suggest to people that the grapefruit or this one will remove residue - they IMPART residue. Awful stuff. Shame on you, Neutrogena. Loyal to you for 40 years. Used to buy other Neutrogena products, glycerin soaps, etc. Not anymore. You won't get my money again.

column6: The formula has CHANGED for the WORSE!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021
column14: I'm a retired chemist and although the label says the formula hasn't changed...it HAS DEFINITELY CHANGED!! The fragrance now has peach and musk added to the strawberry which makes it super strong and weird smelling and is NOT the mild strawberry it use to be. The reason they can legally say that the formula hasn't changed is because on the label, the fragrance change still gets to be on the label as "fragrance." That is the dishonest and misleading problem of my profession. So I am letting you know that the law allows them to say the formula hasn't changed, even though it has, because the LABEL hasn't changed. I have been trying to.get this law changed at the FDA, that just bc the label doesn't change doesn't mean they get to legally say the formula hasn't changed. It HAS changed!! If you change it you change it. So be warned, the CHEMICAL formula has definitely changed even though the LABEL formula has not. Don't be decieved. The fragrance is HORRIBLE!?!

column14: I always thought l was doomed to greasy hair. It just wouldn‚Äôt last after l washed it. It got to a point where l could wash it twice a day. Turns out my old shampoos did a lot of build up of wax and such. That‚Äôs what hair stylist told me. So l did some digging and this shampoo sounded promising. Within 3 uses l can see it works. Even with conditioner on my ends it still looks fresh. My hair was this nice last time l was a kid. It cleanses but doesn‚Äôt over-dry scalp. Scent is nice, minty.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
column14: I wasn't keen on having a wet bar in my shower melt away so I took an old potato peeler I didn't like and shaved bits off the bar into a plastic container with a twist on lid. I take a few bits (like 3-4) shavings, put them into a small travel bottle, add a bit of hot water and shake to get bits melted.  Then apply to wet hair.  It's been working pretty good and my scalp has itched less after two washing.  I definitely see I will have months of shampoo and no plastic bottles to waste my time washing to most likely not be recycled.  I have to add a saved a chunk of the shampoo bar so when I get low I can reorder more, but tempted to just order a couple of more bars to be sure this particular brand and formula I can get.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021
column14: I have a very sensitive nose, so smells play a big role for me. This bar smells great, not too powerful, and not too vague - just right and unique. It lathers up real well, and it feels very hydrating and smooth. However, it is anything but that after all is said and done. My hair was a giant mess, stiff, and was left feeling super heavy. I decided to use my daughter's detangler which is usually great leaving the hair smooth and residue free. Not this time. It was AWFUL. After blow drying it, I was left with a stiff, whitish and heavy wig-like hair. Impossible to manage, and felt super dirty towards the end of the day. The next day, I could have lift it the hair and it would have stood up on its own. However, I thought maybe I used too much or didn't rinse well, so I used it a second time and this time I rinsed extra good. No matter. Three days later and after using my old shampoo, I still can't get rid of the residue and stiffness. It has STRIPPED all the shine off my hair. I hope I can get it back. I would not use this if I were you.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2021
column14: This product states that it‚Äôs made from 3 ingredients on the Amazon listing (which are supposedly organic and natural) but the actual package had more listed, including fragrance which could be any combination of chemicals. The scent is so overpowering I find it hard to believe it‚Äôs even remotely natural. Giving 3 stars tho bc it works great for my hair, I don‚Äôt even need to use conditioner. I have tried so many bar shampoos and none have worked nearly this well.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021
column14: First of all, I literally loved the package. It‚Äôs totally echo friendly packaging with no extra useless plastic covers. It made my hair really stuck so I need to use my own rinse, I highly recommend everyone to use their rinse after using this. Scent and the texture were good especially the scent. It easily makes the bubble so I can rinse all my hair. I don‚Äôt know why there is grape fruit in the middle of the soap, trying hard not to take a bite.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2021
column14: Have enjoyed my initial experience. I had heard that shampoo bars lather less than liquid. So far, not the case for me. A few quick rubs around my short hair, and lather forms and lasts. Some hair care and soap products leave a waxy film, that feels squeaky at first, only to discover that it is a clingy layer. No residue, and my hair does not feel weighed down. Looking forward to seeing how long this bar lasts and how it compares in uses per bar vs. uses per bottle of shampoo. So far, I think it compares favorably. I appreciate doing something for the planet by reducing throwaway plastic, without compromising on comfort and convenience. Great product!

column6: Vegan, Cruelty-free, plastic-free, nice shampoo bar
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021

I will definitely keep using this shampoo bar.

column6: Appreciate the scent and lather, maybe not the best for certain hair types.

All that said, I think it's at a good price point (paid 6.97 USD) for the amount of time it's likely to last me. This is why I'm giving it 3 stars.

column6: Saved wavy hair from moisture overload!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
column14: PSA: Don't be scared by reviews saying it dried their hair out. This is a protein set, protein will dry your hair out and make it brittle if overused or if your hair doesn't like protein. Read up on protein moisture balance! Love this stuff! It's not perfectly curly girl friendly because of a certain silicone, but it's one that is easily taken care of by regular clarifying. If you're wavy like me, odds are you're doing that anyway, so it's fine. My hair was over-moisturized for WEEKS after trying out some Shea Moisture products and the way to balance that out is by adding in some protein. After one single wash I saw major improvement in my curl pattern (it may have taken more washes but I'd already been going weeks without conditioner, etc. to help). The lifeless, greasy frizzy feel is gone.  Smell amazing.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2018
column14: I'm not really sure how long the 'transition period' is supposed to last, but I gave it two weeks and it never got any better. My hair literally felt filthy for two weeks. But I couldn't possibly rinse anymore than I had already been, considering my hair was matting in the water, post lather. I've never used a shampoo bar prior to this, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I don't believe I can continue using one. It's too much of a headache just to save a bit of plastic... So I've chosen a different route to conserve and canceled my subscription. With that said, this review is not for JUST this product, it very well may apply to ALL bar shampoos, but I'll never know. I gave 2 stars, the smell was great and it lathered easily, minus a star for gross feeling hair, minus a star for having to throw my brush away, and minus the last star for my hair matting in the water. Hope this helps...

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2019

column6: Greasy hair - but good for shaving

column6: ... to give this one a try because it had pretty decent reviews
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2018
column14: SO I've tried numerous shampoo bars at this point and decided to give this one a try because it had pretty decent reviews. I am really surprised after using the product. The size of the bar is substaintle in comparison to many others too. However, on first use I knew it wasn't love. First it didn't seem to lather as well as some other brands I have used. The last straw was when I realized the amount of build up on my scalp. I was finding that I could scratch my head and get soap build up under my fingernail. NO THANK YOU.

column14: I started "graying" in my early twenties and was 50/50 by 30. Always had lots of compliments on my "silver hair" (silver fox, etc.). Now in my 60's I am completely gray and noticed that it "looked" gray and not so "silver" anymore. I noticed that frequently there seemed to be a yellowish hue in certain lighting. I tried vinegar rinses and a few other suggestions I found online but never really felt anything changed. I bought this product after reading reviews on every Amazon listed shampoo for gray hair. I found a huge difference in prices. I selected this product because it seemed reasonably priced and I didn't want to spend a lot of money for something I wasn't sure would work.  I ordered it and received it promptly.  First use I noticed it was VERY purple and had some concern about staining shower area but that turned out to be not a problem. Left it on for 2-3 minutes as suggested.  Dried my hair with towel and went about dressing, etc. When I went to brush my hair before leaving for the office, I noticed that my hair once again looked more "silver" than gray.  I actually received a couple compliments that first day about how handsome I looked and I have to think it was related to the product.  I use it a couple times a week and it has a noticeable effect on keeping my hair more silver looking than gray. It also seems to a very good quality shampoo in addition to addressing the gray back to silver issue. I'd recommend trying this product before going to one of the more expensive shampoos.

column14: I am dark-haired so, alas, I cannot use purple shampoo. First, I got her the Bedhead brand one, and she said it was a nice shampoo but did nothing in terms of color-depositing, and was barely even purple-toned out of the bottle.  My platinum blonde-haired friend highly recommended Milk Shake, and I could tell it was effective judging by the silvery purple glow on her own hair.  This shampoo was a total win for my mom.  Her hair looks so silvery and awesome.  From what I gather, you can either build this up so you get a purple sheen like my friend has by leaving it on for longer, or if you want to keep things subtle and not deposit any color, you can wash it out quicker.  I can't believe how great these results are, and I'm honestly jealous that I can't have hair like that.  She's already asked for another bottle, and I really hope Amazon keeps selling this because I don't think she'll switch away from this. I'm sure I'd look terrible with blonde hair, so I'll have to settle for seeing the super groovy effects on other people.

column14: Ken Nichols of Raw Curls advised curly girls/boys to use this product to return our mangled hair/scalps to normal after using DevaCurl products.  I lost handfuls of hair, have bald spots on my scalp, had terrible itching ‚Äúdandruff‚Äù and scabbing after using DevaCurl products.  I ordered it and used it ONCE - it did make my hair feel like straw before conditioning, but cleaned my scalp meticulously.  It takes just a LITTLE product to product major lather and when used with a scalp brush, completely brings your scalp back to health.  I LOVED DevaCurl products until I suffered through the hair loss and itching/scabbing.  I will NEVER use Deva products again. column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2021
column14: I recently started experiencing some severe hair breakage. After doing a little research I found that Malibu c a undo-goo and the hard wellness shampoo to be responsible for the damage. I spoke with my boyfriend about this as he is a doctor. The scalp has a ph between 4.5-5.5 and the hair shaft has a ph of 3.67. Your shampoo needs to have a similar ph as your scalp. A ph higher than 5.5 with disrupts the protective lipid barrier. Your conditioner should have an even lower ph to match the hair. A shampoo with a ph of 9 is extremely alkaline and damaging. To put that into perspective permanent hair dye has a ph of 8.5-9.2. Using this shampoo will create similar damage to that of hair color. The hard water wellness shampoo isn‚Äôt much better. According to the manufacturer‚Äôs website It is formulated at 6.0-6.8. Please spare your hair.

column6: I didn't care for this product at all. Waste of money
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2020
column14: I don't know if I somehow got ripped off and didn't get the actual Kenra product, because I have read other reviews that were good.  And I don't know how that would even happen. All I know is that the shampoo and conditioner both had a very light purple color to them which seems to jive with what I've read on the description of the product. Just for clarification, I have very thick but fine hair.  It's gotten thicker in recent years due to grey coming in.  My natural hair color is dark brown. But I have been bleaching it blonde in the last year.  So I decided to try this because I try to keep my hair a whitish silver blonde.  It's not even close to the typical blonde when you think of blonde hair, I think more of a yellowy gold color comes to mind because most natural blondes tend to have natural golden tones in their hair.  I am very pale, so gold or yellow doesn't look good on my skin tone.  I really wish it did.  So I did use it a few times to give it a chance but I had to stop using it, because right off the bat I noticed when I shampooed my hair with it, my hair which had felt fairly soft before instantly got knotty.  I don't know if there is a strong chemical in it that is meant to remove build up of  metals or minerals in your water that are known to yellow the hair. But whatever the reason I expected the conditioner to fix that.  I would have thought that the conditioner would make my hair soft and manageable again. But I was disappointed to soon find out that no, it did not. In fact it didn't seem to make any difference in the way my hair felt, which is important to me being that my hair might be thick but its very fine, so it makes it even harder to comb through without ripping and pulling half my hair out if its not soft enough after a shower. And using both of them I felt made very little difference in toning down the yellow.  For me whatever difference it did make was not worth the way it made my hair feel which was knotty and unmanageable and very dry feeling afterwards.  Many people with a different texture of hair may disagree, especially if your a natural blonde. Because if your hair is unprocessed maybe it wouldn't have the same effect.  But this was my experience.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
column14: Purple shampoo is supposed to either keep your hair from yellowing or some are meant to help get the yellow out once its already happened.  This shampoo did neither.  Not only did it not help the brassy prgression of my bleached blonde hair( and girls who bleach you know what I mean), but the Shampoo turned my hair into a giant knot.  It felt so ratty and course after I used them.  Just awful.

column6: Beautiful Long Lasting Colors At A Very Reasonable Price!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2022
column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: I was excited to get this lip stain set as I had read good reviews about it.  It comes with six different colors with unusual scientific names such as:  Beakers, Vials, Flasks, Condensers, Distillation, and Test Tubes.  They arrived in a plastic bag and were each in their own little box.  The bottles inside are cute little nipple top bottles, but the top is not a squeezable dropper type.  The applicator wand inside(attached to top), is just the right size with an angled sponge tip.  I found it very easy to apply with precision.  I tested all colors on my hand, and the color Flasks on my lips.  It didn't say how long it takes to dry, so I gave it a good 10 minutes.  After 10 minutes I applied water(as it said it was "waterproof"), and smeared it a little.  There was some bleeding of color, but after wiping off the excess that bled, there was still a substantial stain left.  I did the "blot test" on a tissue and only a small amount of color came off my lips.  When I tested it by drinking from a straw, there was no transfer at all of color.  I even licked my lips a few times and ate something and most of the stain remained on my lips.  I even used soap and water on the colors on my hand, and five out of the six colors remained.  I am VERY PLEASED with this lip stain set.  It has beautiful long lasting colors at a VERY REASONABLE price!

My sister has completely different hair from me, not problem hair as I consider mine to be. Her hair is thick, wavy, and smoother than my hair but I turned her on to this shampoo and conditioner and she‚Äôs sold as well. My only complaint is the packaging from the shipper; the bottles are packed loose in a box and get thrown around during shipping. The product itself is glorious, highly recommend the conditioner as well.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020
column14: I'll start by saying I've used Surface products for years, and the Surface Therapeutic Awaken Shampoo is amazing.  I'm in my early 50s and have had thinning hair since my early 40s.  I've used this product for about 2 years, and my hair is now as thick as it was in my 30s.  My reason for the one-star rating is the packaging.  I opened the plastic white envelope today after it arrived and noticed a considerable amount of shampoo inside the envelope.  I can hold the bottle up to the light and see approx. 25% of it leaked out of the lid during shipping.  There was no plastic/bubble packaging or tape over the lid.  The bottle was just loose inside the envelope.  The price of this item has gone from $59 to $67 in a month.  In my opinion, that's expensive for a 33 oz. bottle, but I'm willing to pay more because it's an excellent product.  However, if customers are paying such a high price, they should receive ALL of the product.  If a simple piece of tape had been put over the lid, I'd have been able to rate this product 5 stars...hands down!

column14: I have not made lipstick before.  I bought this kit so I could repair a broken lipstick and try making lip scrubs. The recipe was soft, so I had some trouble getting it out of the mold (I even broke the lipstick) but used the included syringe and was able to place it in the tube and roll it up and down.  This kit included two lipstick tubes that work really well.  Next time I will experiment with the recipe to make the lipstick harder and maybe use a q tip to oil the silicone mold for an easier release, but I really like this kit and had fun. column14: First of all: my hair is straight, super-fine, and thinning at an alarming pace. I have used Keranique only twice, but each time the result has been much less than wow. Apparently it's not a color-care shampoo (I concur with some other reviews in that it seems to drag the color down), and though it has a pleasant enough scent and lathers nicely, it has not done anything noticeable in the hair-growth and hair-thickening department. The conditioner on the other hand is plain horrible. It is waaaay too light and does not detangle the hair, AT ALL. My hair doesn't feel anywhere near smooth after working the product in, I have to use a comb and use an enormous amount to reach the desired result. Which is not reached, regardless. My stylist advised not to use any voluminizing products because they tend to leave you hair dry and brittle. Am going back to my store-bought Herbal Essences "Color Me Happy" combo which leave my hair feeling so smooth. Conclusion: This Keranique purchase was equal to throwing 40 bucks into the garbage. At least for my type of hair, but that's precisely the point.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2018
column14: I like the camera... as a 2K dash camera goes.  This is NOT a real 4K, it is using a 4MP CMOS that is artificially adding pixels to give you a 2K picture blown up to the size of a 4K.  It is no better picture quality than a 2K dash camera (which I already owned).  You should NOT run the camera at 4K@24FPS because you are just fooling yourself.  Run it at 2K@60FPS or pay the money to get a real 4K.  You can compare the video and you will see as I do that there is no quality difference (ability to read license plates at night) between 2880x2160 24FPS, 2560x1440 30FPS, and 1920x1080 60FPS (the pictures look exactly the same because they are really all the same lens resolution, but the 1920x1080 60FPS is a better video and you can read license plates *better* but no easily at night).  If this company was just honest I would have no problem with the camera... but false advertising and robbing ignorant customers is WRONG WRONG WRONG.  No stars for YOU!

column6: Returned, not ready for prime time
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2021
column14: Ordered this for the family minivan. Really don't understand where this item gets such a high rating, but as we have come to expect on Amazon the manufacturers are manipulating the ratings with giveaways, etc. The cords are absolutely not long enough on all fronts. The power cable is not long enough to reach from the front seat cigarette lighter. The connection cables for each monitor are also not long enough to reach from seat to seat in your average minivan. This is my biggest pet peeve with the manufacturers of these is they need to include at least another three feet of cable on all of the connecting cables. The plastic mounting brackets are also worthless on your average minivan as the screws aren't long enough to screw into the headrest posts. They do have straps so we tried those, they just slip right off the headrest into a position that isn't viewable for the average child. Part of the reason we bought these is because of the plastic mounts and not the fabric straps as we've been down that road before. The screens are nice, that is one positive we can say about them. Unless you're using these in an economy or compact car we cannot recommend them whatsoever.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2018
column14: Installation was easier than I thought, everything works. Great media receiver for the price. A few things worthy of mentioning to write a helpful review. For my car (Toyota Prius), the unit appears to match up with standard double DIN size, however, the framing around the factory radio exceeds the standard size, resulting in a big gap. It's about an inch and  half difference or 3/4 in on each side. This makes it impossible regardless of the mounting kit used to eliminate the gap because some of the factory framing is attached to the original radio. In my case, unless I bought the $100 harness, I would lose the temperature and steering wheel controls, so I bought Toyota harnesses that match up to the new one and attached the remaining factory harness back into the factory radio. Basically, as a cheap solution, I have to leave the unusable factory radio mounted and this new one underneath it. column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: I was really excited to use this device seeing that it gives you Android 9 in your car and all you have to do is own a vehicle with wired CarPlay to use it! The setup was really easy just plug it into your CarPlay USB, connect to it via Bluetooth, and you‚Äôre all set. You don‚Äôt need a 2018+ car, as I did it with a 2017 and it worked fine! Onto the device features, it very much is android 9 down to the core with a skin on top. Most apps will run pretty smoothly like YouTube and Hulu for instance but I‚Äôve noticed that Google Maps is incredibly slow and I usually have to force close it to the point where I ended up going back to CarPlay in general as it was just taking too long to load map data. There‚Äôs split screen which is super useful though if you want to rock Google chrome and Netflix or YouTube. The browsers run fine, not too slow and not too quick. I think for the asking price the devices should be able to get a cpu or ram buff to handle more demanding tasks like maps as it really shouldn‚Äôt take that long but in general this device is pretty solid for everything else! It‚Äôs cool to have a fully functional version of android in your car!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
column14: This camera is great for me. It's a small/compact dash camera with the ability to record both front and inside of cabin. I had a previous dual dash camera that I had to run the rear camera wire throughout the cars trim and it was a pain. I needed a new camera but I didn't want the hassle of running wires throughout a van. This fit the bill as far as features. High def 1080@30fps quality recording for both front and rear cameras, the front and rear cameras are built into one solid device, GPS and WI-FI, The Wi-Fi feature is so awesome to be able to watch recordings through the app instead of taking the camera out or the MicroSD card out to view the recordings. Infrared LED lights for night time recording of inside the vehicle, photograph mode, G-sensor, Motion detection, Parking mode, Fatigue Driving Alert (which sends a time alert that you can set from 1,2,4 hours to take a break), easy to install and easy to navigate through menus and settings.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
column14: I was looking for a dash cam, but didn't know where to start. After browsing for a while, I stumbled upon this one. I looked at all the features and thought the price was decent so I decided to get it a try. I am glad that I did get it. It was easy to set up and to get started I didn't have to open the instructions manual. I inserted an extra micro SD card that I had lying around, hooked up the USB cable, and it worked right away. It was pretty intuitive. After finally reading the instructions I saw that there is an app for it. I downloaded it and found it easy to use. The pictures and videos in this review were downloaded from the app to my phone. It was easy to do.  The video quality is pretty clear. It records both inside and outside at the same time. The sound quality is also pretty good, however I removed it from the video for privacy reasons. I saw some cams that are way more expensive but I have also saw that are cheaper. I don't know how good those cheap ones really are though. The only negative comment I have is that it doesn't come with the memory card. Maybe they can bump up the price $20 and include one in a future release. So far I definitely recommend this dash cam.

column6: This shampoo does exactly what it‚Äôs designed to do!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2018
column14: Blonde hair is a job to maintain if you naturally have a darker shade of hair. A lot of the reviews left on this product are from ladies with not enough education on how the blonde hair/purple shampoo fully work. The comments saying that it made their hair bluish/purplish and leaving negative feedback is because there‚Äôs no education behind how purple and blonde work together. The dryness of the hair after using this product is also uneducated...Who would think that by bleaching your hair and maintaining a color that‚Äôs not naturally your color is going to not dry your hair out? There‚Äôs a double edged sword here.  You want light blonde hair, here‚Äôs some things to remember when using a purple shampoo...1- the opposite of blonde is purple, so the shampoo helps brighten your dingy blonde. It‚Äôs not unusual for your hair to have hints of purple the first time through. It WILL wash out the second or third time. 2- you‚Äôre using purple shampoo to lift some brassiness off of your hair. It‚Äôs not unusual for your hair to be slightly drier when you rinse the shampoo out. Your hair WILL go back to normal the second or third wash. 3- use the purple shampoo every 3 or 4 times you wash your hair. Don‚Äôt lean on this as your daily shampoo. The more frequently you use it, the drier your hair will become. The product does exactly what it‚Äôs supposed to do if you use it correctly. I applied the shampoo on dry hair and left it on for abou 10 minutes, then washed it out and followed with conditioner. This helps brighten the hair (as well as give it the purple pigment, as it should) without diluting the shampoo with water. I was going for a brighter look. Using it to shampoo your hair in the shower for a minute will do the trick, too, but keep in mind that the shampoo gets diluted when water is added to it, causing it to not lift as much beassiness as you may want. The product does exactly what it‚Äôs designed to do, so if you feel the need to complain about the product making your hair blue/purple or drying your hair out, maybe blonde isn‚Äôt a a color option that you should continue to maintain. There‚Äôs a price to pay for beauty, so do your research!
