column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2018
column14: I have dyed blonde hair that was turning brassy and yellow so I bought this shampoo/conditioner combo. I read lots of reviews and watched some YouTube videos. A lot of the videos are about how to turn your hair white or purple which isn't what I wanted, but there were some that were about how to remove the brassy color. My first tip is to start slow. The first time I used it I left it on for 1 minute, now I'm leaving it on for 3 minutes. Better safe than sorry. Play around with the timing but be cautious and go longer the next time if you're not happy with the result. Your hands turn purple, but wash them right after you apply the shampoo and it will wash off (duh).  Have a cleaning rag in the shower to wipe down all of the purple splatters, it might be hard to remove if you let it dry, so just take care of it right away. It is pretty drying, so use conditioner after you wash the shampoo out. I have been using it once a week, and that's working for me.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019
column14: I bought this shampoo and it arrived quickly and the bottle was vacuum packed nicely. I would describe the scent as "clinical"....it's not pleasant at all. Despite the offputting smell, I used the shampoo on Monday morning. I washed once and didn't get much lather, so I used a little more and washed again, then followed up with my usual conditioner. Once my hair dried, it felt very dried out, stripped, and stiff after using this shampoo, even though I had used my normal conditioner which always makes my hair very soft and silky. Not this time....it wasn't enough to combat the dryness this shampoo caused. It totally stripped my hair. (For reference, I am a Caucasian female with long, color treated brown, 3a/3b curly hair and I don't use heat on my hair...I even air dry it). To reiterate, I used this shampoo on Monday. Now this is where the story gets scary. I woke up today (3 days after using this shampoo) and discovered a BALD SPOT about the size of a dime located in the very center of my hair about 1cm back from my hairline.  It is VERY NOTICABLE! I have never in my life had a bald spot. My hair is not thinning, and no baldness runs in my family either male or female. So imagine my shock when my normally thick hair has a HOLE in it. The skin on my scalp is not inflamed or injured in any way, nor was my hair pulled out by me or anyone else....my hair is simply GONE.  I am not blaming my bald spot on this shampoo, but it is the ONLY thing I have done differently with my haircare routine for about a year. It could just be a coincidence, but it is a very scary coincidence. I have a Dr Appointment next week to rule out any medical issues, and if I discover it is indeed a medical issue, I will alter this review, because I do not want to be unfair to this product. However, I felt I had to share this story based on the chance that this shampoo might be the cause. I just want to save others from the mental pain I'm experiencing right now as I walk around with a large bald spot on the front of my head.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
column14: I use this Aveeno Skin Relief Pump Wash, the Aveeno Eczema Therapy Daily Moisturizing Cream, and the Aveeno  Colloidal Cream in the plastic jar each day, and my eczema has completely healed and is gone! It is like a miracle for me. I've been fighting itchy rashy eczema on my hands and it was spreading to my arms, and I had never had it in my life. This went on for 2 years, and my dermatologist put me on 3 or 4 different creams and/or steroid creams and none worked. I also used at least 10 different natural creams, oils, washes, etc. and NOTHING worked. I even tried fungal creams! Naturally, that didn't work, as it wasn't a fungal rash! Desperate people do desperate things. I love Aveeno products and had tried several, but did not know they had eczema therapy products. I discovered them on Amazon and figured why not try? So I always wash my hands with the special wash (I just put it by my sink, since it's a pump), and I follow up with the Eczema Therapy Moisturizing pump lotion/cream, and I use the thick colloidal cream only at night. Within ONE WEEK, my eczema stopped itching and started to fade! In 2 weeks, it was totally gone! I am ecstatic! I showed my husband and we were both in shock! I mean, I have tried EVERYTHING! Even an expensive honey from New Zealand that did nothing! This is the best most remarkable stuff I ever used and now my hands are soft and totally clear, and I can wear bracelets and rings again! I am getting some for a friend who has way more severe eczema all over than I had, but she's tried everything too, so maybe it could work for her. Good luck, as it has been AMAZING for me!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2018
column14: After trying Mrs. Meyer's hand soap at a vacation rental, my family members campaigned for me to buy some for our home.  The rental provided the Basil scent, which we all loved.  I ordered 3-packs of that scent and 3 other scents, with the assumption that we would enjoy them as much as before.  These soaps are nothing like the experience at the vacation rental!  We all believe that these soaps at Amazon are some sort of knock-off made by a third-party contractor.  The soap does not lather, so you will tend to use more, and the scents are so off-putting!!! They are totally different from the original experience.  The four scents I ordered were--Rhubarb, Lemon Verbena, Basil and Bluebell.  They are listed from most disgusting to least offensive.  You're welcome.  The Rhubarb is a cross between raw rhubarb and dirt (NOT rhubarb pie), the Lemon Verbena smells like prairie grass after it's been in a heavy rain then the sun comes out, making it steam out a "this is why I hate humidity" smell.  The Basil has an herbal smell of some combination that should never be, and the Bluebell is a little too floral.  On a bright note, since you need to use more soap to get it to lather, you'll get through it faster, and maybe you won't have exposed all your friends to the abuse of the unpleasant odors.  They may question your tastes, doubt the friendship, and become scarce--it's that bad!!!  If you buy too much of it, like I did, you can save it for out-of-town guests that decide to overstay their welcome.  Out comes the soap, and voila!  Guests leave, problem solved!!  Thanks, nasty soap!!!!

It's a very comforting relaxing smell and if you like the smell of almond, you will enjoy this product. There are very few beauty products that I'm willing to spend $25.00 on for an 8.4oz bottle, but this is one of them. CONS: I just wanted to warn others purchasing this, that your bottle should ALWAYS be filled to the brim. If you ever receive a bottle that is not filled to the top, something has gone wrong, and you should return it. A lot of people won't realize that when they receive this product UNLESS they are familiar with it. I just wanted to make sure everyone thinking of forking over $25.00 was aware.

column14: I have been using this solid shampoo for about a month now. The actual formulation is really great. It is not drying or moisturizing and does not weigh hair down. My only real complaint, and it's mild, is the bar itself: I hate the shape. Sure, it's pretty and it's fine to hold, but I don't think the shape is ideal to rub on your head. I MUCH prefer the usual round shape, which all other shampoo bars use. I am guessing someone designed this convoluted shape to differentiate it from all the others, but in my opinion this bizarrely shaped (although aesthetically pleasing) bar isn't an improvement. That said, I'd still recommend this low-waste, efficient, effective shampoo. I have tried quite a few of them, over a long period of time, and hands-down, this one is BY FAR the best.

The fact is also, neem oil is best used when you mix it with some sort of soap to help it bind together to spray on your leaves. I was desperate one day to clean my dusty leaves and figured that this organic formula is actually PERFECT as long as you dilute the soap with lots of water. I used one tiny pump with lots water and mixed it in a spray bottle onto a microfiber cloth. This concoction worked BEAUTIFULLY for getting the job done and I haven‚Äôt gotten any pests since then. My leaves are so shiny and beautiful and since taking off that layer of dust on them, they have been growing faster as there‚Äôs nothing impeding them from  receiving ample light. I do believe the original version is best for this HACK since we don‚Äôt know how the essential oils on the other options are going to react to your plants. As far as a body cleanser, it is nice however I still prefer something with SLS from time to time to get rid of grime and a little funk from the underarms. column6: Overwhelming Orange - I Ordered Green Tea Lemongrass
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2018
column14: Lathers well, cleans well, and works well as a shave gel. I ordered Green Tea Lemongrass scent, however, it smells like orange. Not just a hint, it's a smack you in the face with righteous indignation ORANGE! For many, this is not a big deal, may even be awesome to feel like a major league pitcher threw an orange fresh from the tree at 90 mph that slammed right between your eyes while standing in the middle of a Florida orange grove. However, I detest the fragrance (also the taste/flavor) of oranges. Needless to say when my husband was decanting it into a smaller pump dispenser for our bathroom he was shocked that I purchased something orange, his favorite. I thought I could deal since it was open, and my orange aficionado husband was happy...and again, it was already open. I was wrong. The scent is not light. However, the nausea from the fragrance has really shortened my shower time in the morning and I am also much more alert as I am trying to keep my stomach settled. I would take off 2 stars for the fragrance (I have a true disdain for oranges) but the scent doesn't linger on your skin so since it's just 3-10 minutes a day in the underworld I kick 1 star. Everything else about the body wash is great, but it's hard to appreciate it while under olfactory assault.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
column14: This product says that it is gentle and "sulfate free".  The second ingredient listed is olefin sulfonate .  While it is not sodium laurel sulfate which is usually in soaps and shampoos, it is just as harsh.  This product is very hard on eyes and other sensitive areas.  I got a mild chemical burn in a very sensitive part of my body.  The smell is not anything like lemongrass.  It smells more like a combination of oranges and musk.  Not an appealing aroma at all.  This product does lather and clean well.  If it had been branded as a hand soap, I probably would have been OK with it.  But it is much too harsh for a body wash.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2018
column14: Technically, a sulfonate is not a sulfate, but they are irritating to skin, and that's what I was trying to avoid by buying this product.  Amazon clearly does zero vetting on how products are advertised, so as far as consumer protection, you are still in the wild, wild west.  Buyer beware.  Only after opening, and noticing the weird way the liquid flowed did I check the ingredient list.  Sure, no sulfates, but saying that is totally misleading.  Cheap crap, worse than Suave shampoo.

column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: AG is one of the premium brands for curly and wavy hair, and this is a pretty good "curly girl" shampoo with proteins and *without* harsh sulfates, cleansers, or silicones. I was happy to find that it lacks both coconut and aloe, since my hair is sensitive to those. Its proteins are small (amino acids), so good for both low- and high-porosity hair. Overall this shampoo works well, but I find that other shampoos have comparable ingredient profiles and work equally well for the price. Typically shampoo doesn't sit on your hair long enough for many proteins to stick around, so if you're on a budget I'd focus on an AG conditioner or leave-in rather than their shampoo per se

column14: I have been using the Tea Tree Lemon Sage Thickening shampoo and conditioner for years now. That just is not possible.  What this does do with consistent use is after I wash with the shampoo and then use the conditioner is provide fuller and softer hair after each wash.  The fullness is very refreshing and natural.  This shampoo smells very nice and lathers up very easily.  With other shampoos I would feel build-up over time but not with this.  I also appreciate the savings buying it in large volume like here.  But what I do not appreciate it that even when purchased from Amazon themselves as I made sure to do this time the large bottle arrived with some of the shampoo leaking out the top.  It was all over the bottle and a pain to wash off but overall a minimal amount though no amount should be the correct amount.  But the shampoo itself will indeed add volume in a natural way to fine and thinning hair.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
column14: I have a lot of hair on my head, but the individual strands are very fine and so I struggle with frizz and little volume. One day my stylist used the Paul Mitchell special shampoo and conditioner on me at the salon and I found myself totally in love with the smell and the way the it made my scalp tingle... And once my hair was dried and styled, I was excited to see some oomph despite the stylist not using any other volumizing products. When I asked her about it I was expecting her to tell me that it was one of the usual high end products that are normally used at salons- you know, the ones that cost like $50 a bottle- but was thrilled to learn how inexpensive they are despite their good quality. Needless to say, I ended up leaving the salon with a couple of bottles and it's been my standard shampoo/conditioner ever since. I have tried other products over the years, such as specialty shampoos that promise to improve strength, growth, and volume, but I always find myself going back to this. I really do feel that my hair is healthier and grows more quickly because of it. I also love this brand because there are several different types and scents To choose from (not sure if they are all technically part of the "special" line, but they do come in the same little green bottles, unlike the other Paul Mitchell products) and I've enjoyed playing around with different combinations. Currently my favorite combo is the lemon sage shampoo with the lavender mint conditioner (although I do still love the tea tree shampoo as well). I've been using these products for about 5 years now and I plan to continue using them so long as they stay available and affordable. And I absolutely recommend them to anyone with fine, flat hair like mine!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2022
column14: I have very fine hair, I have my whole life. Over the last few years, it has begun to thin gradually. Nothing crazy, but over time its lost some of its volume. Not to a point that a nice wash with a good shampoo wouldn't be able to hide any noticeable lack of coverage. I've used Organix (OGX) biotin shampoo, Avalon Organics biotin etc. and was happy with both. Nothing but typical couple loose hairs while shampooing or a few loose hairs when brushing afterwards. I was running low and decided to give this biotin a try seeing it had added claims such as DHT blocking properties.  I cannot regret that decision more. After a couple weeks of using this product my hair began falling out in clumps and my scalp became extremely itchy and flaky. Its typical for anyone to lose up to 100 hairs a day but this lead to over 100 per wash and every brush. I'd brush in the afternoon to check if it was still happening when dry and I'd lose even more. All I had to do was run a flat hand down my head and I'd be picking up 50 or more hairs out of the sink. I stopped immediately after realizing it had to be the shampoo. After a couple weeks of stopping with the shampoo the constant extreme itching has stopped and the flakes have lessened significantly but the hair fall is still more than I've ever experienced at any other time in my life. Its gotten to a point that you can see scalp all over my head, sides, back top everything.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
column14: First, some background: I am a female, 22, and I started buying professional shampoo after experiencing hormonal changes and living in an area of China with very polluted water and air caused my hair to dramatically change structure, fall out, and be so brittle that I could not brush it or it would break and fall out in pieces. I bought this product along with the corresponding conditioner upon recommendation from my hairstylist, and at first I thought it was a miracle, because it made my hair so soft and sleek. I was so excited, and spent $60 bucks on more of it after I used my first order. However- around the 6 month mark, I noticed my scalp was flaking more than usual. I chalked it up to winter weather, and ignored it - until I started noticing scabby patches appearing under my hair. I could not understand what was causing it, and tried discontinuing leave in conditioners, and changing pillowcases and diet- but nothing worked. The final straw was when my follicles started detaching: hair would drift down from my head in the middle of the day and I would see it on my shirts or in my car. It was awful- and then when I was reordering this shampoo, I noticed one of the one star reviews ALSO mentioned hair loss and dry scalp. I stopped using it and my scalp healed by the next week, and my hair loss has stopped over the last month. I switched to Garnier triple nutrition and that works way better with no irritation, and costs $7 at Target. So I would not recommend this- I spent $120 prolonging my hair recovery journey.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
column14: My goal for this product was to achieve hair growth which may not be your primary motivation. About two years ago I noticed that my hair was thinning badly. I‚Äôm going to be 58 next month and I have left  what used to constitute One pigtail that‚Äôs now a single ponytail.  . I had the classic male pattern thinning above my temples and with my bangs. I was completely freaking out as my hair is kind of my signature feature. It‚Äôs always been wavy and fine but pretty. I also let my silver grow out about four years ago and the lack of processing has made my hair healthy,  shiny and soft. At the end of 2018 I embarked on this research project about how to re-grow my hair and keep what I have from hair care products, the way that I treat my hair,  and nutrition. They said not to keep your hair tightly wrapped up and to let it flow, that washing your hair every other day was better because it removes buildup on the scalp, so I dumped the Pantene and tried the biotin shampoo starting two years ago. At the same time I start Taking the 5000 mg of biotin pills for hair and nails from natures bounty that I got at Costco. And at the beginning of 2019 I research which vitamins and foods to eat which include anything high in vitamin A like red and yellow bell peppers, red cabbage, spinach, Sweet potatoes, Butternut squash and cauliflower‚Ä¶ along with almonds sunflower seeds salmon eggs and Greek yogurt.  I bough this Nizoral In April 2019. As of today I have an entire undercoat of fine new hair but it‚Äôs only about 4 inches which leads me to believe that the biotin shampoo really didn‚Äôt affect things all that much. Four Inches of hair growth is about 8 months. So I went back on to Amazon to see you when I first bought this  dandruff shampoo and lo and behold it was in April which is eight months today - January 1, 2021. I do believe that nutrition is key along with stress management and sleep course. But I find it really interesting that I‚Äôm able to trace the number of inches to when I bought this shampoo.  I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs 100% direct correlation but I can testify that is working for me in the hair growth department. I also found a different hair growth vitamin that I‚Äôm going to start using next week.  It‚Äôs called Hair La Vie.  Last observation. I did use Nioxin 3  for a number of years and I don‚Äôt think it worked as well as the shampoo coupled with the nutrition. Because I still had a lot of hair thinning of the temples which is now filling in considerably. And also Nioxin dries your hair out badly. I like alternating between the biotin shampoo and this dandruff shampoo because the Biotin Shampoo is less drying than Nizoral.  The key is to get it worked up into your scalp really well and just let it sit there for a while so you have to like use it less often. I hope this helps you I know How agonizing it is to lose your hair especially when you‚Äôre a woman. Good luck

column6: Yes, it can turn your hair lavender!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2018
column14: Since May 2018, 5+mos, I have only used this shampoo & conditioner which has turned the under layers of my shoulder length hair lavender. I bought it in hopes of changing the outermost layer from a light blonde back to silver which hasn't happened. I don't know why some of my hair turned blonde--regular shampoo, leave-in hair products to keep my very thick unruly hair tame, or too much sun except I always wear a hat? It used to be very dark chestnut brown in my youth (never blonde). I never died my hair, it started changing to salt & pepper in my early 30s, now more salt than pepper in my early 60s. Strangers, even hair dressers, told me how beautiful my hair color was, I could trust them over family/friends :-)  Six yrs ago my hairdresser helped me grow it out from a very short style and suggested shampoo for silver hair which I never tried until this. I've been thinking if it was still short, cut regularly, this lavender tinting wouldn't have happened, but just today I noticed an attractive woman with almost white short hair and could see a slight tint of lavender to it! I asked my husband if I was imagining it, he said no, he saw it too. From what others have reviewed this doesn't happen to everyone but it can happen! I've now tossed this shampoo & conditioner and have bought a shampoo for blonde hair promising to make it two shades lighter in hopes it might remove the lavender and the blonde from my hair. I just hope like one reviewer mentioned that it doesn't turn green! I may have to have it cut very short again and start over. Of course these days any color, every color, seems to be in :-) It's amazing that young women are dying their hair to look grey which usually has a lavender or blue tint to it.

column6: The Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner are amazing products
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
column14: I decided to order the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for severely damaged hair cause I was having a lot of hair breakage and shedding and I absolutely resented hair wash days. My hair was brittle and seemed always dry no matter what products I would put on it. I thought that I would have had to cut my hair and start completely over. However, when my products arrived, I could not wait to give them a try. I love the smells. Very nice and not powerful. I washed my hair twice with the Nexxus Shampoo, first time just the scalp, and the second wash, the hair itself. The way that my hair reacted to this shampoo was breathtaking! My curls appeared and believe it or not, I was able to pull a comb through my thick, natural, 4C  hair!! I have never, ever been able to do this before while washing. Barely any hair was coming out in my comb! I had not even used the conditioner yet. I just had to stop and look in the mirror and talk to myself saying, "Omg, I cannot believe this"! I have never, ever experienced a shampoo doing my hair like this before. After I completely rinsed the shampoo from my hair, I moved on to the Nexxus Conditioner. Even more amazing. It stated to leave on the hair for 3 min, but I sat under a hooded dryer for about 10min with the conditioner on my hair, under a plastic cap. Once my time was up, I rinsed away all of the conditioner. My hair was so manageable!! I was able to comb and section it to do my bantu knots and allow my hair to dry overnight. After washing my hair, it only took me about 30 min to get it  all done to dry. I have never been able to complete this process this quickly before! I am highly satisfied with these products! Even though they are  expensive products, I'm hooked and will be purchasing again. I told my mom about my experience and am ready to try it on her hair also, to see if she gets the same experience and satisfaction that I got. Thank you Nexxus for such wonderful products, and thank you Amazon for carrying them. Definitely a must try on the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for Severely damaged hair. This is my first time ever writing a review on a product. That's how pleased I was with these products!!

column6: Looking for something to help with greasy, color treated hair? You found it.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
column14: I have been excited to leave a review for this product! I dye my hair but unfortunately have a greasy scalp. It's hard to find a shampoo that helps greasy hair that is color treated. THIS IS IT. My color doesn't fall out and it helps with greasy hair! Obviously, there is no product that can completely eliminate the problem of having greasy hair. It's important to have realistic expectations. Try using this product for a month and then evaluate your results. I still need to use dry shampoo, but I have tried a lot of products and have found nothing better than this. It's also important to follow the instructions. Massage slowly into scalp and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Repeat process. You must do this process twice or you will not see the results you're looking for. You'll notice the first time you put it in, there will be little to no foam/soap. The second time, you'll see LOTS of foam/soap. This is how you know it's working! All in all, I think this is great product to help greasy hair and to maintain your color.

I have literally tried everything on the store shelves to get some relief with absolutely no results or relief. So at this point I was willing to try just about anything. So after searching here on Amazon I came across this shampoo, read the reviews, mostly good and a few bad. I bought my bottle about a month ago, and have been using it faithfully everyday. I feel comfortable now giving this review. I have to be totally honest, I was skeptical, but it has made a huge change in my scalp health. I have no more flakes on my dark shirts, and the itching has totally gone away. I still have a couple of patches I‚Äôm still working on, but wow, what a difference. Some here have said the smell is pleasant, but I wouldn‚Äôt say pleasant, maybe earthy, kind of like wet potting soil. Although this has calmed my scalp, my hair ends are very frizzy now, worse than usual, so I just use an intense conditioner now. My hair is 99% white and gets dry and frizzy naturally any way. column14: I have been using the Tea Tree Lemon Sage Thickening shampoo and conditioner for years now.  My hair stylist first recommended it and it has worked really well on my fine and thin men's hair.  I think some get this thinking it is going to provide fuller and thicker hair that remains and does not go away.  Meaning it will over time provide permanently thicker hair.  That just is not possible.  What this does do with consistent use is after I wash with the shampoo and then use the conditioner is provide fuller and softer hair after each wash.  The fullness is very refreshing and natural.  This shampoo smells very nice and lathers up very easily.  With other shampoos I would feel build-up over time but not with this.  I also appreciate the savings buying it in large volume like here.  But what I do not appreciate it that even when purchased from Amazon themselves as I made sure to do this time the large bottle arrived with some of the shampoo leaking out the top.  It was all over the bottle and a pain to wash off but overall a minimal amount though no amount should be the correct amount.  But the shampoo itself will indeed add volume in a natural way to fine and thinning hair.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
column14: I have a lot of hair on my head, but the individual strands are very fine and so I struggle with frizz and little volume. One day my stylist used the Paul Mitchell special shampoo and conditioner on me at the salon and I found myself totally in love with the smell and the way the it made my scalp tingle... And once my hair was dried and styled, I was excited to see some oomph despite the stylist not using any other volumizing products. When I asked her about it I was expecting her to tell me that it was one of the usual high end products that are normally used at salons- you know, the ones that cost like $50 a bottle- but was thrilled to learn how inexpensive they are despite their good quality. Needless to say, I ended up leaving the salon with a couple of bottles and it's been my standard shampoo/conditioner ever since. I have tried other products over the years, such as specialty shampoos that promise to improve strength, growth, and volume, but I always find myself going back to this. I really do feel that my hair is healthier and grows more quickly because of it. I also love this brand because there are several different types and scents To choose from (not sure if they are all technically part of the "special" line, but they do come in the same little green bottles, unlike the other Paul Mitchell products) and I've enjoyed playing around with different combinations. Currently my favorite combo is the lemon sage shampoo with the lavender mint conditioner (although I do still love the tea tree shampoo as well). I've been using these products for about 5 years now and I plan to continue using them so long as they stay available and affordable. And I absolutely recommend them to anyone with fine, flat hair like mine!

column6: More hair loss compared to regular shampoo
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
column14: I am going to write this review for both the coconut wow shampoo and the acv shampoo by wow since I have used both and my oldest has tried the acv. (1) I have no idea if this is supposed to for all hair types. It isn't. (2) In 2016 my husband and I went through a stressful time with a company - not wow - that ruined my stress level and caused my hair to thin out more than what it already was. When dealing with that company was done with, my hair was not thinning out as much and i wanted to try and get new hair growing in and work in decreasing hair falling out. I tried the wow acv and I noticed more hair was coming out than regular shampoo. I read it was not really for helping hair to grow back so I stopped. However, my oldest, who had incredible thick hair, used it because she loved the smell of it. She stopped using it after a month, but never said why until recently. Will get to that in a bit. (2) I started using the wow coconut to help with stimulating hair growth. THe hair loss was the same for women my age with thin hair. early 40's it happens but was not that bad at all. I only wanted to stimulate the hair growth where it was showing thinness in some areas. I used the wow coconut the first time. 3-4 times the hair came out than with regular shampoo. I used regular shampoo the next time. the usual 5-15 strands of hair would come out. I would hten use the coconut. 3-4 times the hair comes out than with regular shampoo. I emailed wow and they said not to use any other shampoo and to only use theirs to be effective. I then washed my hair with wow coconut and 3-4 times the hair came out than with regular shampoo. didn't wash it for 2 days. used coconut wow shampoo again, 3-4 times the hair came out. waited another two days before washing my hair again. I was nervous to use it again, but decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. washed it and sure enough. 3-4 times the hair loss from regular shampoo. I know everyone loses on average 100 strands of hair a day, but this was insane. I then decided I was done and I needed to find the shampoo that did work for stimulating hair growth and did work (the only reason I stopped that one was because the peppermint was so strong it made me lightheaded, but I would rather wash my hair in the kitchen sink and endure the strong peppermint and have a product that works then lose hair with wow). I had asked my oldest who used the wow acv if she still uses it. she said no. I asked her why because I was curious if it was causing her beautiful think hair to thin out and it thinned out a lot. she flat out said she stopped using it because of all the hair that was falling out when she used it. She went from having to have her hair thinned out every 2-3 months with a pile that looked like a small bunny to having thin hair. This only happened when she used the wow. She said when she uses anything but wow, she has no problems with hair falling out. I don't know why the wow coconut and acv shampoos made our hair fall out, I was really having hopes with all the reviews, but there is nothing wrong with either of us for our hair to be falling out like this. Again, it only falls out 3-4 more when we use the wow coconut and acv. If we use suave, tressemme, herbal essence, we do not have an issue at all. We have the normal amount fall out that we have our entire lives that is common for everyone. I will be seeing if I can return it since it is in the time frame. I want to keep my hair. Not have it thin out 3-4 times faster than what it normally would have.

And that‚Äôs all I was really looking for but it turns out it also was fantastic for my skin! I‚Äôve never felt my skin so moisturized. It feels smoother, silkier, dare I say younger?! So as I sit here waiting to meet my public defender for my most recent charges of trespassing, indecent exposure (a ball slipped out‚Ä¶.oops), interfering with official acts, and resisting arrest, I can‚Äôt help but say thank you, Biolage! Your product has added even more joy to my life‚Äôs passion. I had the time of my life, and I owe it all to you.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2017
column14: As a swimmer I have to wash my hair every day, which causes it to accumulate a lot of grease after just 12 hours. column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
column14: Many of the reviews state it does not cover small stubble or coarse hairs especially on the side of your temples. I realize from using hair dye in the past that it's the amount of time that is on your head that matters the most especially on the coarse hairs on the sides. The directions state only use it for a minute or two, you're not going to get any effect from it in any great way with such little time. From day one, after the allergy test, I started using it on my entire head for at least 10 minutes. Since we're in quarantine I have all the time in the world so I did this three times each day. My hair to start with was basically 60% Gray, fully noticeable. At the end of day three using it three times a day 10 minutes each time the top of my head which is longer was basically finished and looked perfect. But the sides still had very noticeable greys and I have my sides cut very short. I remember my barber would always leave the hair dye on much longer than recommended. I decided to see what would happen if I started to use it only on my sides for 20 minutes at a time. Bingo after two days three times per day I have even color throughout. Now I can use the maintenance dosage when needed which would probably only be once every two or three days. I realize not everyone has the time to do this three times per day but at least leave it on longer for about 20 to 30 minutes in the beginning..the results will come quickly and then you can get to your maintenance ASAP without having to worry about the stubborn course greys.

It isn't the same shampoo, but I have not noticed any of the ill effects mentioned in reviews here. The strong scent (coconut, I'd say) goes away as my hair dries and is rather pleasant. ASSOMBSFDM&LN doesn't "moisturize" any better than its predecessor, but what does "moisturize" really mean, anyway? I have dry hair, before and after I shampoo it. column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
column14: First, some background: I am a female, 22, and I started buying professional shampoo after experiencing hormonal changes and living in an area of China with very polluted water and air caused my hair to dramatically change structure, fall out, and be so brittle that I could not brush it or it would break and fall out in pieces. I bought this product along with the corresponding conditioner upon recommendation from my hairstylist, and at first I thought it was a miracle, because it made my hair so soft and sleek. I was so excited, and spent $60 bucks on more of it after I used my first order. However- around the 6 month mark, I noticed my scalp was flaking more than usual. I chalked it up to winter weather, and ignored it - until I started noticing scabby patches appearing under my hair. I could not understand what was causing it, and tried discontinuing leave in conditioners, and changing pillowcases and diet- but nothing worked. The final straw was when my follicles started detaching: hair would drift down from my head in the middle of the day and I would see it on my shirts or in my car. It was awful- and then when I was reordering this shampoo, I noticed one of the one star reviews ALSO mentioned hair loss and dry scalp. I stopped using it and my scalp healed by the next week, and my hair loss has stopped over the last month. I switched to Garnier triple nutrition and that works way better with no irritation, and costs $7 at Target. So I would not recommend this- I spent $120 prolonging my hair recovery journey.

column14: I searched for an organic shampoo with natural ingredients and this product came up. The reviews were good and I purchased it. I went ahead and used the product about 4-5 times. Today, I got curious again about what the back of the bottle says. So, I got out a very bright light and a powerful magnifiying glass, and with the help of my husband we were able to determine that there is a warning on the bottle about using this product that can lead to health problems. The product should be tested on the skin 48 hours before each use, as a reaction could happen anytime it is used. They list a slew of ingredients, most of which sound like chemicals, but are unrecognizable to me. It is too late for me to send this back, but I am going to stop using this product at once. I find it unacceptable for a company to put warning label in such tiny cramped print that it cannot be easily read.

column6: The formula has CHANGED for the WORSE!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021
column14: I'm a retired chemist and although the label says the formula hasn't changed...it HAS DEFINITELY CHANGED!! The fragrance now has peach and musk added to the strawberry which makes it super strong and weird smelling and is NOT the mild strawberry it use to be. The reason they can legally say that the formula hasn't changed is because on the label, the fragrance change still gets to be on the label as "fragrance." That is the dishonest and misleading problem of my profession. So I am letting you know that the law allows them to say the formula hasn't changed, even though it has, because the LABEL hasn't changed. I have been trying to.get this law changed at the FDA, that just bc the label doesn't change doesn't mean they get to legally say the formula hasn't changed. It HAS changed!! If you change it you change it. So be warned, the CHEMICAL formula has definitely changed even though the LABEL formula has not. Don't be decieved. The fragrance is HORRIBLE!?!

column6: Saved wavy hair from moisture overload!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
column14: PSA: Don't be scared by reviews saying it dried their hair out. This is a protein set, protein will dry your hair out and make it brittle if overused or if your hair doesn't like protein. Read up on protein moisture balance! Love this stuff! It's not perfectly curly girl friendly because of a certain silicone, but it's one that is easily taken care of by regular clarifying. If you're wavy like me, odds are you're doing that anyway, so it's fine. My hair was over-moisturized for WEEKS after trying out some Shea Moisture products and the way to balance that out is by adding in some protein. After one single wash I saw major improvement in my curl pattern (it may have taken more washes but I'd already been going weeks without conditioner, etc. to help). The lifeless, greasy frizzy feel is gone.  Smell amazing.

column14: I'm not really sure how long the 'transition period' is supposed to last, but I gave it two weeks and it never got any better. My hair literally felt filthy for two weeks. I've never used a shampoo bar prior to this, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I don't believe I can continue using one. It's too much of a headache just to save a bit of plastic... So I've chosen a different route to conserve and canceled my subscription. With that said, this review is not for JUST this product, it very well may apply to ALL bar shampoos, but I'll never know. I gave 2 stars, the smell was great and it lathered easily, minus a star for gross feeling hair, minus a star for having to throw my brush away, and minus the last star for my hair matting in the water. The residue looks like grease, leaving me with permanantly greasy looking hair, and it makes it take over an hour to brush out my thin, curly hair without ripping all of my hair out of my scalp (especially because the hair being sticky makes it catch and pull all hairs around it into tighter knots), and it then leaves a thin, white, sticky residue all over my brush.

column6: Just for Men grey reducing shampoo, for lighter shades of hair, blond/brown
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2020
column14: I was born with white hair.  It turned light brown but by the time I was thirty it was back to white.  I've tried several items to color my hair, over the years, not wanting white hair.  Most were messy, most didn't work very well, and so I decided I would have white hair.  But, I have a 10 year old daughter.  Shopping with her people would say, "are you shopping with your grandfather today" ?  So I thought I would try again with this shampoo reducing grey; I've never seen a shampoo style before.  This works, and I am so pleased with it.  I followed the instructions and used it four nights in a row, in the shower.  I have short hair so it doesn't take a lot to shampoo into my hair.  I immediately wash my hands after putting it into my hair, and finish washing, watching the clock.  The first night I didn't notice anything.  The second night I thought I could see a little color.  The third night I was sure I could see a very light brown.  The forth night my hair was very light brown, just the way I wanted it.  It was not messy to use.  The instructions say to dry with an older towel, which I did the first night.  But nothing came off onto the towel, so I  just dry with my regular towel now.  I do rinse very well, again, in the shower.  It would be difficult to rinse that well in a bath tub.  The top of my head is a little darker than the sides, probably from the way I apply it.  This makes it look very natural in that every hair is not the exact same color.  I'm very pleased with this product.  It is easy to use, it doesn't get all over everything (like some things I have tried) and the price is reasonable.  My plan is to use it once a week, to keep the roots from coming in white.  I will adjust my usage as needed.  I wrote this review to help you see that this product is different, easy to use, and might be what you have been looking for, as it was with me.  I didn't have any chemical reaction to this product, but be sure to do the test the product recommends.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020
column14: I‚Äôm a woman, and love this for my hair! I‚Äôm brunette, mid-40s, with more gray than I‚Äôm ready to have. I don‚Äôt want to spend the time or $ on professional coloring, and don‚Äôt want to make a sudden change with boxed color. This is perfect. I used the original brown for a long time, but I love the blond/light brown even more. I used each day for the first several days, until my grays look more subtle. Then I use once every 3-4 days to maintain. Easy as shampooing in the shower! No one has a asked if my kids are my grandkids since I started using this! And, I didn‚Äôt just show up at work with completely different hair one day. Love it!

column6: Wish I Had Tried It Sooner
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2021
column14: So here's my story. I'm mid-60s and have been totally grey for a number of years. In fact, it's been trending more towards white these last few years. I didn't suddenly want a headfull of brown hair. What I was hoping for was a look that was age appropriate. Something that toned down the old man look that I saw in the mirror. I tried this product right after getting my haircut. I have them use a number 4 blade on the sides and back (so pretty short) and then leave an inch and a half on top. I used this every morning when I showered, putting a portion about the size of a quarter in my palm and massaging it in with my palms. I then left it in for about two minutes before rinsing it out. After that I applied a conditioner and then rinsed that as well. I didn't notice anything different for the first few days. It was day four when I first saw some slight darkening. Now, after day eight, it is to the point where I would call it a golden grey, if that makes any sense. The white is totally gone and it's sort of a deep grey color with blonde highlights. I actually like the look. It doesn't look at all dyed or fake and seems totally age appropriate. Years back I tried the typical out of the box dye, and this is a much more natural look. Now the challenge will be how to proceed in maintenence mode to maintain the look. My only regret is that I didn't try this sooner. Great product! One note: I did have a small amount of fingernail staining. Not so bad that anyone would notice though. After both massaging it in and rinsing it I would wash my hands, but a little staining still occurred.

column6: This is so easy to use.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2018
column14: I have been using this product for at least 6 month's now, and it does work.  It is expensive but a little goes a long way, and one tube of this product will last for at least 8 weeks-maybe longer-if you do not use more than needed.  Keep in mind that hair grows slowly.  Your hair did not get thin overnight (a good thing!) and it wont get thick overnight.  But use the product for at least a few months (using every other day) and you will begin to see results.  Hair loss will stop, then your hair will begin to get thicker.  You will start to see new hair coming in.  Give it a try!  I would also use an oral supplement that is an herbal vitamin and a "DHT blocker" .  These are available from many different manufacturers and prices.  Will work all that much better as DHT is what causes hair loss in men & women.  Just my personal advice on adding the herbal DHT blocker supplement to use with Zenagen.

column6: 10 Months in and it's definitely working
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2022
column14: As the headline says, I've been using Zenagen Shampoo (and Conditioner also) for about 10 months and I'm definitely noticing results. Before I started using the product, I started noticing a lot of hair falling out in the shower and my hair getting much thinner at my hair-line (for context I'm in my late-20's, so this was starting to concern me). My barber recommended Zenagen for Men because the chemicals they use are supposed to be healthier and her customers reported good results. I bought both the shampoo and conditioner and started using it at least twice a week. By month three I noticed new hairs growing right at my hair-line. By month 6, I noticed significantly less hair coming out each time I showered. Now at month 10, I'm not even worried about hair loss anymore. My results have convinced my Dad to start using it and he is currently 2 months in. Consistency is key, so for the sake of maintaining the health of my hair, I'll be using this from now on. The shampoo smells good and when coupled with the conditioner makes my hair feel and smell great. I definitely recommend anyone experiencing hair loss to try this product. In the 10 months I've had it, I've only had to restock 4 times. You don't need a lot of it!

My hairdresser recommended getting shampoo with tea tree oil in it and that was sulfate free and recommended shampooing my hair about half the time. I started googling shampoos and I found this one. I am not one to believe in spending a lot of money on hair products, so I was more than please with this price. When I tried it though, I couldn't believe how amazing it was! It didn't lather great the first time, but after letting it sit for about 2 minutes then rinsing, I scrubbed again and it lathered amazingly! I also let that round sit for about another 2 minutes and rinsed. My hair had never felt so clean after shampooing. Ever! I also let the conditioner sit for about 2 minutes then rinsed. The shampoo wasn't the best smelling shampoo I have ever tried, but the conditioner smells great! I love how it makes my hair feel and smell! And most of all, no more itching, flakes, or bumps! My scalp is completely revived! I will never use another shampoo or conditioner. I was 130% pleased with this purchase and can't believe it only cost me $25!! I cannot say more good things about this product! After only 2 uses, I have already seen a drastic difference!!

I bought both the shampoo and the condition as add on items and they're cheaper on Amazon than at Walmart that way.  Can't beat $4 (each) for a good shampoo and a good conditioner! column14: Be ready to relax and shampoo your woes away with this awesome aromatherapy essential shampoo. Use it in the winter when a combination of lack of humidity and the cold air will leave hair lifeless and dull from weather stress, and bring it back in summer to tame headaches and ease the tension in your neck after a long day at work. Lather, let it it sit, and then convince yourself to rinse away the tingle that comes from this shampoo. The tea tree oil will help keep dandruff at bay, and the peppermint makes your hair so soft! Used by beauticians everywhere. Once you experience the minty tingle, you won't want anything else to touch your tresses, so it's a good thing they have a conditioner that complements, down to being the same composition in a moisturizing, soothing formula. column14: I have medium thickness, slightly wavy hair that is down to my waist and tangles very easily. I get greasy roots, and my ends are very dry and prone to breakage. I start at the roots and suds up my scalp and then squeeze the suds down to the ends of my hair. I rinse and then repeat doing the scalp again due to my oily scalp. This gets my hair super clean and I don‚Äôt have to use conditioner except a small amount of leave in on the ends.Sometimes, I don‚Äôt even need the leave in conditioner if I am not too vigorous with the lathering.  The bar is still going strong as of January 22, 2022. I shampoo my hair about 2-3 times a week this way due to the length of my hair and the dry ends. The bar lasts a long time. It smells wonderful like honey. It lathers well and my hair doesn‚Äôt feel too tangled unlike with regular shampoo and even conditioners.  I saw Drew Barrymore‚Äôs Instagram post showing her hair, which appears to be similar to mine in length and texture.  I thought I would try it.  I was very surprised.  If it helps cut down on plastic, cleans my hair and smells good, it‚Äôs a win-win.  One thing, when ordering from Amazon they ship it in a big oversized bubble wrap plastic envelope mailer.  That kind of defeats the purpose of the packaging that the bar comes in.  Next time I will see if I can find it in the store.

column14: It is sulfate free. Sulfonate and sulfate are two different components. Sulfonate is related to but not the same as sulfate. Sulfonate the sulfur is linked direct to a carbon atom; where as a sulfate is linked directly to the carbon chain via an oxygen atom. I have a Chemistry background. it is good for people to know this. Shampoo is sulfate free; and it is not misleading.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
column14: I bought this set based on a you tube video. She said it was best on extensions and full lace wigs. I have a full lace that needed a little extra care because it has aged. I tried two times, each time airing out the hair hoping that it will die down. A week later and the scent was just as strong. I have tried an endless variety of shampoo and conditioners from Pantene and DevaCurl to Aveda and Wen.  None of them satisfied my hair for more than one bottle, always leaving me with the same results of dry ends and a frizzy mess.  Honestly thought it was a hopeless cause.  Then I found Mineral Fusion.  Who would have thought that a reasonably priced shampoo and conditioner could work such wonders on my dry, frizzy hair.  I'm not saying that it is perfect, but its pretty darn close.  I have even been able to extend trimming my hair by a couple of months since my ends haven't dried out.  My hair is the softest it has ever been and actually has a nice healthy shine to it.  It gets a little puffy on humid days, but not frizzy.  Styles easily and feels good.  And I'm on my 3rd set! Its definitely worth a try, especially for the price.

column6: Seems to be working, but it will take months to see the results
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
column14: I had read that caffeine could help with hair regrowth, and that the results are similar to  minoxidil without some of the hair shedding. That is main reason why I chose a caffeine infused shampoo. I decided to try Alpecin Caffeine Shampoo C1 based on the reviews. I have been using it for nearly a year, and I have seen some hair re-growth. It does make the remaining hair grow much more quickly as well. I have a bald spot on the top of my head and it extends to the crown (front of my head). There is some hair still there, but it has significantly thinned out over the years. This shampoo has definitely stopped the loss, and in the bald spot on top  and the balding area in between some hairs have come back to my amazement. I am not sure if continued use will help wake up any other dormant follicles or not,  but I believe that it is helping so I am satisfied enough to keep using it. I think it smells fine. I didn't see any increased improvement when I used the Double Effect version, though - it seemed to work about the same.  The C1 version is the one I use mostly.

My hair is very thick to begin with but I could tell it was definitely thinner and felt as if it just had a hair cut. Mind you male pattern baldness does not run in my family nor mothers and my fathers hair is like a helmet which does not thin, only turns grey. I digress. Do not buy this shampoo. column6: I‚Äôm reviewing the product.... not the packaging. üôÑ
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
column14: We are about a month into making the switch to bar soap. We will never go back. I have of course seen all the reviews with people complaining about the mesh bag. I am personally in the beginning stages of going waste free so, duly noted to all you hardcore waste free folks. As far as the mesh bag... I‚Äôll recycle the friggin thing. So no matter which way you slice it, it‚Äôs less material than a bottle of shampoo, a water bottle, etc. That said, I love these. It lathers well, is gentle enough for my children, the scents are lovely, and everyone in the houses hair is softer, and shinier. My husband and I both had issues with flaking and dandruff, and that has STOPPED completely. Which is amazing because I have been trying for YEARS to find an organic/vegan product to combat this with no luck. I‚Äôm a big fan, and I‚Äôll continue to order, and I‚Äôll continue to recycle the mesh bag, as well as the packaging box. My apologies to those that are soooo upset about the mesh bag, paper box, and the sticker that is on the wrapper of the bar (like... really?), but I‚Äôm giving 5 stars for the product itself, not it‚Äôs packaging. Just read the description of the different benefits of the varying scents. I have the honey, rosemary (for shine and moisture) and the cinnamon, and ginger (for hair growth). I have noticed faster growth in my hair, and certainly more shine. My only suggestion would be for the company to give the option of the mesh bag for repeat customers. But other than that, it‚Äôs certainly an affordable and great product for those starting out on a waste free journey, and wanting to have healthy hair in the process.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2018
column14: A sad fact of life: we have mites that live on our faces. Sometimes those mites can have an overgrowth and cause problems, especially when they're in your eyelashes. I was having a lot of trouble with blurred vision and itchy eyes that my eye doc originally thought was bacterial, and she recommended I use baby shampoo daily as a lid scrub. It helped some, but I was still having issues. I started researching to see what else I could do, and I found an article online about these mites and it fit the symptoms I was having. The article talked about one doctor treating mites with the application of tea tree oil in his practice. I didn't want to apply straight tea tree oil to my eyelids so I thought I should try a tea tree oil shampoo in place of the baby shampoo. I bought this product and started using it daily in the mornings after waking up. The itching and blurred vision vanished within a couple of days. I still have some issues with dry eyes but this shampoo certainly seemed to put the mites out on their weird little butts. I still use it daily and recommend it to other people if you're searching for an anti-mite lid scrub. I haven't tried it in my hair but I'll bet it works great there too.

column6: Flake free and safe on my highlights !!!

column14: This was #11 out of...maybe fourteen or fifteen shampoo bars I've tried so far. It's my favorite, by a long, long mile. Here are the reasons why:  1. It is not a castile or oil bar, it is actually a syndet bar, so it actually cleans your hair, especially important if you have hard water.  2. It's solid, and doesn't threaten to crumble like a lot of the really popular brands.  3. The smell is intense, yes, but it doesn't overpower once you've rinsed. 4. It's not drying, like some of the puck-looking varieties. Yes, you need a conditioner after, but don't you usually need one anyway?  5. The heart shape is actually really easy to grip - it's the only one I haven't dropped by accident!  6. It really lathers; protip: don't try to lather up your hands, then transfer to your head and expect that to work. Run the bar directly through your hair and work it up that way.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020
column14: I‚Äôve been trying to be more eco-friendly and purchase items without plastic lately. I have bought a LUSH shampoo bar before, and absolutely loved it so I decided to give other companies a chance. The scent is not something I usually go for. I prefer tropical flowers over rose garden types. I opened the box and immediately thought I was going to struggle with the scent. I gave it a try though and was pleasantly surprised after a few uses. At first thought, I loved the shape and feel of this bar. It‚Äôs easy to grip and seems to hold up fairly well. The soapy feel threw me off a bit. It also seemed to be less moisturizing than my LUSH bar. But, after a few times using this, my hair felt so light and my layers were pretty happy with it. The scent faded away and doesn‚Äôt bother me at all anymore. I love this product. I still mix it up with my LUSH one when I want to add more moisture to my hair vs. airy/soft feeling. My hair usually gets oily pretty easily and this doesn‚Äôt add to it at all. For the price also, you can‚Äôt beat it!

column6: NO MORE LIQUID SHAMPOO BOTTLES FOR ME!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
column14: I LOVED the low price for this shampoo bar.  I LOVE the results after several uses. I won‚Äôt be buying liquid shampoo again. YAY zone less plastic bottle in my bathroom!  I think I‚Äôm going to order several more and give them away to friends for Valentines Day.  The bar is heart shaped.  Perf!

column6: An eco friendly alternative to bottle shampoo üß¥
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2020
column14: I started looking into switching to bar shampoo to be a little bit more conscious about my beauty routines environmental impact, and I decided to try this one along with two others I got on amazon as well. The bar itself is shaped like a heart and comes in a recyclable cardboard box (it doesn‚Äôt come wrapped in plastic like other soaps). The scent was strong when I first took it out of the box, however when I lathered it up and actually washed my hair the scent was a lot more subtle. I usually wash my hair with shampoo twice every shower so the first wash I didn‚Äôt notice much of a lather, however after I rinsed it out and did my second wash I noticed a big improvement. I didn‚Äôt use conditioner because I wanted to see what the shampoo would do on it‚Äôs own, so I just brushed  out a few tangles and went to bed. The next morning I noticed that my hair looked a little softer (it didn‚Äôt physically feel any softer) and I straightened it before going to work (I did apply my normal heat protectant spray). When I got to work my boss told me that my hair looked extra shiny and asked me if I did anything to it.

column14: I have ALWAYS loved Morroccanoil products. I've used them for over 15 years. Recently, my salon stopped carrying Morrocan Oil products. When I saw the shampoo and conditioner on SALE for Amazon Prime Days 2021, for $14 off the usual price, I ordered BOTH the Smoothing Shampoo and Smoothing Conditioner. Normally I do not order this BIG 33.8 oz size, but the price was too good to pass up. AND now that I have them, I like the fact that they come with a PUMP on the top of the bottle. Easier in the shower than the flip top on the smaller bottles. I originally started using Morrocan Oil products at the recommendation of my stylist, beginning with the Moroccan OIL. (The photo is of MANY of my previous products.) I LOVE the scent!!!  I have thick, wavy, dyed hair, and have sometimes used the Repair line, and sometimes the Moisturizing line. As I've aged, and since I live in the high arid desert, my hair gets "flyaway". The Smoothing line works for reducing that "static" in my hair.  You won't go wrong with any of these products, and the scent is divine!

column6: Definitely worth a try - surprisingly effective root cleansing, and moisturizing without heaviness
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2016
column14: I have to admit I was VERY skeptical of all the rave reviews here.  However, I've had luck with Argon Oil products in the past to help repair my very fine, thin hair, which is extremely oily at the root and extremely dry at the ends.  I realized I needed a moisture shampoo (since I now live in the desert, and the dry climate makes my hair looks absolutely fried).  It has also had a lot of processing done to it, but every "repair" or "moisture" shampoo I try is WAY too heavy for my fine hair, weighs it down, and never cleans my oil-slick roots well.  Desperately, I turned to this product because of the reviews, the sulfate-free description (my hair is color treated), and my past success with Argon Oil.  I am, quite frankly, amazed at how good it is.  I expected another shampoo-turned-hand soap situation.  This stuff actually cleans my roots, while imparting lightweight moisture and shine to the rest of my hair.  It has truly helped rebalance my scalp and repair my fried ends.  Because it cleanses without overdrying, my roots now produce less oil to compensate, and I can go longer without washing my hair (which is also better for its health).  This is one of the ONLY shampoos I have ever tried that can do this.  I attribute this to the inclusion of Argon and essential oils, which have amazing lightweight yet deep moisture properties (without heaviness or greasiness) if balanced well with other ingredients.  This was a very random, but very fortunate,  product encounter for me.  I highly recommend trying this (and for less than $15 a pop, this is a bargain compared to "high-end" shampoos...which this Arvazallia outperforms anyway, at least for my hair type).

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2019
column14: I have very dry and course hair, so I'm always looking for products that give it some hydration.  Back when I tried this shampoo my hair was really bad and damaged from lack of hydration.  After using this shampoo a few times I noticed my hair was suddenly never clean no matter how much I washed it.  It always looked and felt greasy and it had lost all of its volume.  I stopped using this shampoo and my hair went back to normal, so it must've been the shampoo that was causing the problem.  If you're looking for a good shampoo for dry hair I'd recommend Amika's Velveteen Dream shampoo.  It's expensive but worth it.  Don't waste your money on this shampoo.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
column14: At first I wanted to LOVE this combo. I needed help with rough fuzzy hair. Then when I smelled it, I wanted to HATE it because I agree, as one reviewer stated, it smells like old style hair color or bathroom cleaner- Fake. Yuck. I have stuck with underperforming hair care for years because I Loved the smell. In the shower I was underwhelmed. The conditioner is a nightmare of packaging, even the tiny size I ordered. It didn't seem to be making my hair slippery like I expected. It combed thru ok, surprisingly. Once I removed towel it combed out easily. Ok, so I dried it. And guess what? My poufy, rough , frizzy hair was smooth. Now I don't know WHAT to do. I like the RESULTS, but the smell is pretty bad, even after drying my hair. I have about 3-4 more uses out of these small containers, and I will see how it 'wears' over the next couple days between washings. What a Quandary. I will update after a couple of weeks with the final decision.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2016
column14: Let me just say that I have been a wayward hair addict binge dieting on the latest and greatest for troubled damaged hair. I've been making the push to find not just healthy products but thoughtfully harvested and designed products that actually work better because of the passionate attention put into them. This lead me to Living Libations and their Wildcrafted True Blue Spirulina Shampoo. My hair washing routine starts with a hundred brush strokes and finger combing to remove any tangles before I wash; then I apply a liberal dose of shampoo. Wow!!!!! What is happening? It feels like my hair took a deep breath of oxygen. No way, can you feel hair breathe?!?!! Leftover tangles fall lose, my hair sighs, I couldn't have been more surprised if Fabio entered my bathroom and messaged this shampoo in himself. I cannot explain the sheer bliss after 15 years of merely acceptable auditions culminating in a shampoo to swoon over. As for the price I admit I was scared, but how much the average person pays for barely acceptable products who's makers care little to nothing about their Impact on intended users or the environment where they were sourced. Your paying for a product that works beyond belief and if you want beyond belief results you have to support the brands giving you the results, it cost money to source ingredients at this high a level. Three cheers for Living Libations!!! I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to have soft, shiny, beautiful, good smelling hair that sings and receives about as much compliments as a newborn.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2021
column14: My journey through the natural hair care world has been long and arduous, but I think it has finally found a happy ending with this shampoo. I have thick, shoulder length wavy-curly hair that has a tendency to get weighed down by "natural" shampoos and completely stripped by more conventional ones - in both cases, it completely loses its will to curl. This stuff, however, doesn't do those things. Even a tiny amount leaves my hair actually feeling clean - even though it doesn't suds up, somehow I can still work it through my thick hair - and after I rinse, I don't feel like I need to follow it with something harsher to really wash my hair. It's clean. After it's dry, my hair feels soft and bouncy - yes, bouncy, which seems impossible to achieve with natural shampoo. It curls better now than it has in months. I will admit, it doesn't look like hair straight from the salon, but I'm guessing if that's what you were after, you wouldn't be here reading this review.

column6: Verified consumer and product user since 2014. Quality Product for Sensitive Skin and Eczema minus the expensive pricetag
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2017
column14: Our son has extremely sensitive skin.  In 2014, he had a major skin breakout that took us several doctor visits to diagnose.  Two doctors diagnosed him with eczema and referred us to a specialist.  The physicians were adamant that skin conditions are extremely hard to treat.  They wanted us to realize that this would not be easy.  The doctor gave us samples of two products.  One sample was this product and the other was Aquaphor Baby Wash & Shampoo.  We use the Eucerin in the bath water and the Aquaphor to wash our munchkin.  It worked! No pricey specialist, medications, or creams.  This did the trick and has work for years.  When the weather changes and we have more severe flair ups we use CeraVe Moisturizing Cream.  The doctor will sometimes prescribe a prescription steroid to mix with it.  These three things have been life savers for our little boy.  Skin conditions are tough to treat. Medications and treatment can be extremely expensive and often yield no benefit.  This is a review from a mom that these products work.  Yes, the Eucerin is oily.  It's an oil to moisturize the skin.  No, we have not ever had problems with it smelling, but I guess that's more of an individual biased.  That said, it doesn't have a bad smell or a great smell.  It's really plain, but if you think scented products typically cause more problems.  The bottom line it works.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019

So this product hasn't fixed her skin, but it is by far the best the  body wash for moisturizing her skin. You can trust our opinion , because we have tried EVERY SINGLE sensitive skin, fragrance free , and "eczema board certified" body soaps out there.

column14: Now I KNOW people are going to probably come for me BUT I found this soap to double as an EXCELLENT plant leaf cleanser!!! The first ingredient is NEEM which for avid planthusiasts, is a necessity for fighting off pests that arise. The fact is also, neem oil is best used when you mix it with some sort of soap to help it bind together to spray on your leaves. I was desperate one day to clean my dusty leaves and figured that this organic formula is actually PERFECT as long as you dilute the soap with lots of water. I used one tiny pump with lots water and mixed it in a spray bottle onto a microfiber cloth. This concoction worked BEAUTIFULLY for getting the job done and I haven‚Äôt gotten any pests since then. My leaves are so shiny and beautiful and since taking off that layer of dust on them, they have been growing faster as there‚Äôs nothing impeding them from  receiving ample light. I do believe the original version is best for this HACK since we don‚Äôt know how the essential oils on the other options are going to react to your plants. As far as a body cleanser, it is nice however I still prefer something with SLS from time to time to get rid of grime and a little funk from the underarms. I usually have something strictly for those CREVASSES (play on words thanks to Tenacious D, IYKYK). Hope this helps y‚Äôall!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2016
column14: This is the SECOND review of this product--the first, written soon after receiving it in May, 2016 and appeared on screen--has quite obviously been taken down as it no longer appears as a matter of record.  Evidently the manufacturer/supplier of Vitabath applied sufficient pressure on Amazon to remove it and Amazon melted in its editorial haste to do so.  To repeat: this is not the Vitabath of former years, which flooded the bathroom with aromatic delight, was thick and foamy, and left an understated pine scent on the user's skin.  If today's buyer looks at the ingredients shown on the product, "water" appears first on the list.  Uh-huh, how else to insure corporate profitability by their revamping the ingredients to insure that outcome?  What at one  time was a grand bathing experience is now "ho-hum" and joins other products whereby the word "mediocre" now becomes the company's gold standard.  Thanks for the memories Vitabath, Inc.--you won't be seeing this purchaser any longer.

column6: Not the same formula! Not as nice.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2014
column14: I just purchased a large bottle of the Original Spring Green Bath and Shower Gelee. I was dissapointed to discover the smell, color and consistency have all changed! I had a little left in the old bottle I purchased sometime in the past year and compared the two side-by-side. The new one is thinner, more blue in color and lacks the intense pine-like fragrance of the old. I would describe it as more of a citrus smell. I also compared it to a small travel-sized bottle I got last month. The travel bottle is the old familiar formula. Did I just get a bad batch? Are there quality control issues with multiple manufactures, or has the formula actually changed? I really hope not! I just looked at the recent reviews on Amazon and I now see that I am not the only one who has noticed this. While the new bottle is not unpleasant, it is not what I hoped for. I would send it back, but it is heavy and cumbersome to return. We will probably use it up, but unless the formula goes back to the original or the quality-control issue is solved, it will be the last bottle I purchase. Very sad.

column6: You'd be dumb for not getting this if your skin tends to break out due to life's little jokes.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2017
column14: This body wash is ridiculous!!!!!!!!!  I live in Manhattan and in the summer, the subway stations turn into SAUNAS because our taxes can't afford climate control.  Sweat pours off you within minutes due to the heat and humidity worthy of hell.  Like most of us in the city, I carry a backpack at ALL TIMES because ya need somewhere to shove the 'things' ya must have.  Your hands need to be free to fight off vagabonds with agendas and carnivorous sewage rats.  The backpack traps the sweat and oil and voila...  breakouts.  With this body wash, it literally STOPS.  It's like being armed with holy water when the devil knocks to borrow a cup of sugar... or your SOUL.  The tea tree oil does EXACTLY what it promises in prohibiting breakouts.  It has excellent lather.. sooo many bubbles.  For the record, I am the quintessential gay man with 24 varieties of gels in my shower (I am not kidding here people).  Once the tunnels heat up, this is the only wash I use because nothing else keeps my skin looking like I actually showered this week.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
column14: Oh my gosh. Quick background story - I decided to foster FIVE kittens with my boyfriend. Everything was going fine at first...but then we started noticing these RED SCALY RINGS on our bodies (at one point I counted over 14 rings...)...it was kind of a disaster because the weekend we got them to foster, my sister was with me, so she got it as well, and so did my mom...and various other pets. ANYWAY...I tried EVERYTHING...I was so desperate; I tried clear nail polish, other body washes, alcohol, benzoyl peroxide, lotrimin, tape, and other products. I started feeling depressed, because nothing was working for the first couple of weeks. BUT THEN I CAME ACROSS THIS WONDERFUL, BEAUTIFUL, MIRACULOUS PRODUCT. Defense soap, along with holding a cotton ball soaked in white vinegar (also switched it up and used apple cider vinegar) was my savior. I had to take showers in the morning and night and let this sit for 1-3 minutes (just to be safe), and within a week, my spots starting fading. I couldn't believe it. This helped me, my sister, boyfriend, and mom. Use this twice a day and give it a week. THANK YOU FOR MAKING THIS PRODUCT. I TRULY DON'T KNOW WHAT I WOULD HAVE DONE IF I DIDN'T COME ACROSS THIS.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021

I understand if you are extremely sensitive, then maybe. But some of the reviews were people saying they were not sensitive and could barely handle the smell. The soap literally has bits of seaweed in it, so it does have an odd smell. But it certainly had no affect on my opinion of the product because so far my skin is loving it. Probably not strong enough by itself to combat acne- but I bought several other products form this line for that. This is a great cleanser for everyday use for those of us who are sensitive to acne medications. I have used this every morning and evening since my purchase, and my skin has had zero bad effects. Which is huge for me regarding skincare. Definitely worth giving it a try if you're considering this buy. I will definitely be open to buying more of this when I go through my current bottle!

column6: Non irritating cleanser that prepares skin for prescription ointments
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
column14: The 4oz bottle has lasted since mid November with once daily washes in cool water. But, I do find it to be the perfect non irritating facewash to use before applying prescription Soolantra. My rosacea is improving now after using this combination and my face definitely feels squeaky clean after using the face wash. There‚Äôs a lot to learn about rosacea and any skin sensitivity, so I encourage anyone struggling with it to read some forums and just try the simpler suggestions first like quitting milk/sugar and keeping your face cool before you resort to potentially expensive prescriptions. And good luck, it‚Äôs a frustrating condition that doesn‚Äôt help self esteem at all.
