column6: It also works great for me after gardening and does not dry out ...
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
column14: My husband is a forklift mechanic for a lumber mill and his fingers are always black.  He has tried multiple types of soap made to cut through the grease and none of it has been able to reach the grease that is embedded in his skin.  Until now.  I saw this soap on Amazon and decided to get it for him to try.  It arrived while he was at work.  When he got home I had him use the Grease Monkey soap.  It worked wonders, that first day he was able to get so much of the grease stain off of his fingers that they were almost normal colored again.  Now he uses it everyday and the only places he has black on his fingers or knuckles is in the cracks too deep for the soap to get into.  It also works great for me after gardening and does not dry out my skin.  The soap is in an oversized bar that seems to be lasting extremely well.  We have only been using it for a few weeks, but so far it seems to be about the same size as when I opened the package.  It has a delightful peppermint scent that you can smell as soon as you enter our bathroom.  It does have some grainy texture to it when lathered up, but it is not near as rough as Lava soap.  I have just ordered 4 more sets so I can give these out as Christmas presents to all the mechanics and backyard mechanics in our family.

column6: Excellent soap to clean grease and grime off sensitive skin!

Having to really scrub in the shower with regular soap wasn't helping his skin either.  It was dry, flaky, and his hands weren't coming out as clean as he would have hoped.  This soap has been a game changer.  It takes care of the dirt and grime much quicker than a regular soap and it's helped his eczema clear up.  I'm sure not having to spend as much time in the shower makes a difference as well.  We will be reordering this often!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2021
column14: The older I get, the more I‚Äôm beginning to see the importance and value of investing into good quality products.  To be completely honest, in times past, I would never purchase Olay products because of the cost.  However; when I learned of its quality and results, I could no longer place a price on the well being of my skin.  Many, if not all soap bars have lye and provides less moisture and hydration for my skin, so I‚Äôve fallen in love with body washes.  True story: I was born and reared in Palm Beach County and lived five minutes from the Atlantic Ocean.  If we got a scrape or cut, we‚Äôd jump in the ocean to help heal it. Perhaps I‚Äôm old fashioned but I still believe in nature having its own medicinal power to heal and cure.  Many folks take sea kelp as a dietary supplement for the many health benefits it‚Äôs purported to have.  For the skin, it has been shown to moisture and hydrate dry skin because of the the antioxidants and minerals it contains.  It also softens skin and removes toxin.  My skin is shiny, smells great, moisturized and much softer after each use and I plan to continue purchasing this body wash with sea kelp.  I know that anything from the ocean has the potential to heal and restore.  Not paid for my honest review either :)

When you have something you're familiar with and it's such a necessity you have it on auto order you tend to stop reading the ingredient list after a while. column6: from the tube it looks like there is a nice spectrum of colors ranging from ...
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2017
column14: This set of lipsticks was rather disappointing in that, from the tube it looks like there is a nice spectrum of colors ranging from soft to deep, but when applied they are all very light-- more like a tinted chapstick in terms of color saturation. Even a straightforward classic red only registers light pink on the lips and when tested on my hand. Some barely register a color. Probably better to spend money on a single tube of lipstick you know you love rather than buy a set of 12 that are just so-so and indistinct. That said, if you like very sheer lipsticks you may like this, but just know that rather than 12 distinct shades, its more like 4-5 shades with very incremental differences between them.

column6: By far my favorite red lipstick!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
column14: I have dozens of red lipsticks.  Why you ask?  Because not all red lipsticks are equal.  Some make your teeth look yellow like a toxic substance, others are unflattering to your skin tone and then a lot of them are drying or bleed or smear all over your face.  I know I can put this lipstick on in the morning (even though I'm not going anywhere I still wear it - strictly for me) and it will still look good before I take it off at night.  So it lasts through lunch, dinner, a snack or 2 and several coffees, pops, waters and tea.  If I eat something that has some oil in it the inner part of my lips might need a touch up but normally I don't touch it all day.  It makes me look better with it than I look without it.  Even my adult son who mostly hates the look of lipsticks on anyone has complimented me on this lipstick.  I think his exact words were - 'nice lipstick'!  That's as good a compliment as I've ever gotten.  I will keep this one in stock.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2021
column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: Yes, this lipstick is super pricey. But it‚Äôs Tatcha and that is to be expected. This lipstick is not just for anyone though. This is for the makeup lover who is looking for a quality formula paired with a luxurious experience. From the moment I slide open the box, the experience began. The design of the component is simple and classy. The detailed gold embellishments take the bullet to the next level making it feel a little regal. The beveling on the lipstick itself is exquisite. But all of that is just the visual experience. Once you pick this precious baby up, it lets you know right away just how expensive it is. This lipstick is weighted. WEIGHTED. The heaviest lipstick I own. I‚Äôm not joking when I say that you could send someone to the hospital if you threw this lipstick at their head. It‚Äôs like a roll of quarters. The majority of the weight is in the cap, so applying it to the lips isn‚Äôt a total workout. But the weight is for sure the stand out with this lipstick. I can literally feel how high quality this product is with just my hands. That being said, the formula is really nice as well. This lipstick delivers in every way. I found the lipstick to glide on smoothly and have a silky texture. Not too thick, not sticky, not streaky, nothing bad. It wears down evenly throughout the day. It‚Äôs moisturizing and very comfortable. It has a satin sheen with a subtle shimmer. Just a lovely lipstick that looks natural and very pretty. I can either use a thin layer for a ‚Äúmy lips but better‚Äù look or I can apply a full layer and have a beautiful soft pink moment. Either way, this lipstick looks great and is the perfect shade for everyday. I ordered it in ‚ÄúCherry Blossom‚Äù, and I would describe the color as a dainty tea rose pink. It‚Äôs not too warm toned and not too cool toned. Just a really nice pink. I don‚Äôt think anyone would be disappointed with this lipstick. You get what you pay for with this one. And what you get is pure LUXURY. I highly recommend this lipstick to all the luxury makeup lovers out there. This one checks all of the boxes, I promise!

Purchasing lipsticks online is the hardest thing to do, so I hope this review can help a little. These lip crayons wear very well over chapstick as they are deep pigmented.

It comes with six different colors with unusual scientific names such as:  Beakers, Vials, Flasks, Condensers, Distillation, and Test Tubes.  They arrived in a plastic bag and were each in their own little box.  The bottles inside are cute little nipple top bottles, but the top is not a squeezable dropper type.  The applicator wand inside(attached to top), is just the right size with an angled sponge tip.  I found it very easy to apply with precision.  I tested all colors on my hand, and the color Flasks on my lips.  It didn't say how long it takes to dry, so I gave it a good 10 minutes.  After 10 minutes I applied water(as it said it was "waterproof"), and smeared it a little.  There was some bleeding of color, but after wiping off the excess that bled, there was still a substantial stain left.  I did the "blot test" on a tissue and only a small amount of color came off my lips.  When I tested it by drinking from a straw, there was no transfer at all of color.  I even licked my lips a few times and ate something and most of the stain remained on my lips.  I even used soap and water on the colors on my hand, and five out of the six colors remained.  I am VERY PLEASED with this lip stain set.  It has beautiful long lasting colors at a VERY REASONABLE price!

As you apply those it feels liquidy and creamy and a little thick. But it doesn‚Äôt take long for it to dry down. It is true to color and it doesn‚Äôt dry down to that hard dry grainy feeling like other matte lipsticks do. It‚Äôs almost like a stain. It is for sure waterproof and I could hardly get it off with soap and water. I really like the set I like the variety of colors and I would definitely recommend it.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
column14: I purchased this in the shades Berry Lit and Fancy Rose.  The Fancy Rose (200) shade is straight up brown.  I‚Äôm not sure how they get rose because there is nothing rose toned about it. Think 90‚Äôs grunge brown lipstick and this is it.  It is very pigmented and leans warm. The Berry Lit (240) shade is very pigmented and vibrant with a dark pink cool undertone.  This color is actually very pretty although it is a little too bold for me. The formula of these is not my favorite.  I was hoping this worked like a lip stain and it does tint the lips slightly but just not enough for me.  It‚Äôs not the most comfortable lip tint but it does have decent lasting power.  My biggest critique is the packaging and application.  I hate these sponge tip applicators.  It seems very unsanitary and it‚Äôs hard to tell when you have released enough product without going way overboard.  The shades are vibrant and pigments, but not very flattering on me.  The ones I‚Äôve tried either lean very cool or very warm whereas I generally prefer a more neutral/nude shade for day to day wear.  Overall, I would just say this formula is ok.  Not the best but not the worst.  I much prefer The Balm Jour lip stains for daily wear.

column6: Allow it to dry for a good three to five minutes without pressing your lips together
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2015
column14: As someone who absolutely hates re-applying my lipstick (and thinks it looks tacky when others do it in public), this is a holy grail product. Anyone who says it doesn't stay on isn't applying this product correctly. Start with dry, exfoliated lips and apply liberally, basically painting it on. Allow it to dry for a good three to five minutes without pressing your lips together, then finish with the balm. This stays on all day and I have to really work to get it off at night. I love not having to think about my lipstick, whether it's still on, or if I need to 'fix' it in the powder room. I'm no longer a hostage to lipstick! And, because I love a bright, bold lip, I'm really thankful for the colors. xoxo

column14: Got this product after watching reviews on YouTube. Read the manual, installed it using the ac adapter it comes with. It worked great for about 6 days then it just stopped working. Wouldnt turn on automatically like it's supposed to. It wouldnt turn on if I held the power button down and it wouldnt turn on if I plugged it into a computer either. I looked it up online and several other people have had this problem. So I called amazon and they were nice enough to send me a replacement. However the end one worked less time then the first. I used the new ac adapter and the new cable just incase it was a faulty wire or power supply but same problem. Worked great for less than a day. No power warnings. No "alerts" at all. Then when I was driving home last night just stopped working. Definitely steer clear of this dash cam.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2021
column14: Powered up on test bench, transmitter overheated to 140+ F & malfunctioned (no video) after 8-10 minutes. Power removed & cooled down for 5 minutes. Powered up again, transmitter overheated to 140+ F again & malfunctioned (no video) again after 8-10 minutes. Repeated test 3 more cycles, same results. Completely unacceptable performance. Typical for 50% or more of electronic equipment I have had to purchase from China. Do not buy this junk. I will not buy from this vendor again.

column6: Don't go to far away from eachother!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
column14: I have a camera on my garage and didn't want to turn a wire to my house so I got this! They are probably 20 feet away from each other and the signal is horrible! Black and white all the time when they should be sending and receiving color. I took them down and moved them 1 foot apart and it worked fine. Its just a sending and receiving issue!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
column14: I used these for a wireless camera system that I put in my enclosed trailer so I could make sure everything was staying in place.  The night vision comes in handy.  I can't speak to if these are truly 5.8 ghz but I can tell you the signal is not a digital signal, it is analog and does not have any security or privacy features.  It requires direct line of site and is prone to lines and interference.  The picture is very clear while sitting still.  But if you are anywhere near a shopping center or gas station where there is a fair amount of wireless activity, you are going to experience interference.

column6: Extremely poor quality, unusable at night
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022
column14: I have both a direct line and the tramitters ran to the same camera (only 1 connected at a time, obviously) and the picture is just TERRIBLE with this wireless kit.  Quality on the direct line is fantastic, super clear, night vision works, but when I switch to the transmitter it is very grainy, choppy and not reliable whatsoever at night.  Can even see a car 10 ft behind you.

column6: As good as a wired connection
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
column14: I easily recommend this (at least so far). The picture quality is as good as with the composite cable that came with the backup camera. Turns on nearly instantly. Easy installation and mounting. Great for those otherwise difficult cable run installs - in my case a 2006 VW Touareg with a Seicane unit.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2021
column14: Signal quality is very poor. Installed transmission distance is about 30-feet. While moving I can actually get an ok signal although it will flicker in an out. While stopped or moving slowly, I get almost no picture which defeats the purpose of using this with a backup camera.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
column14: The transmission quality was much better than the transmitters they were replacing (those little egg shaped ones with the tiny antenna). Didn't see any interference or break up, well, while they were running. They worked through testing and at initial install but when I was finished and turned everything back on,, NO SIGNAL.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
column14: Had to order a second time because the AV prong busted off easily. Now I have an extra transmitter. After having professionally installed quality is still sketchy loses connection from small bed truck tailgate to stereo unit. Little fuzzy at times.

column6: Great dash cam to protect yourself
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
column14: This is a great dash camera  that will give you peace of mind that in case anything happens while driving, you will have a high resolution recording of what transpired, including any road signs, license plate numbers and any signal lights. In case of an accident, it will not be a case of everyone having different versions of the event but rather having available an impartial recording of exactly what caused the accident.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021
column14: I bought 3 dash cams to try with a requirement of having motion sensor. Cambase, GilrayGrow and Kingslim.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
column14: This dash cam has all the features you want in a dash cam.  The images in 4K are amazing and very clear, exactly what you want if you have an accident or see one. You can also opt for less resolution and use less memory.  The included cables ran the full length of my full size van.  I did have to fashion a mount for the rear camera in the back door of the van.

column6: Pretty good and did what I wanted

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021

column6: Absolute POC. Do not buy! Do not listen to fake reviews

column6: If you spent double, you wouldn't get a better camera.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
column14: I am a bit of a helicopter mom so I am naturally worried about my son driving.  This is a good way to monitor his driving habits so I know that he is being safe.  I also think it serves as a reminder to follow the rules because mom is watching.

column6: Battery life doesn‚Äôt last and keeps turning off
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2021
column14: I liked this dash cam in the beginning, but it has only been a month and I‚Äôm already having issues with it. ‚ÄúLow battery‚Äù is starting to pop up, even when it‚Äôs plugged into my car and I have charged it at night. The cable connection is part of the issue because the red light indicates if it‚Äôs charging and that hasn‚Äôt been turning on like it used to. That‚Äôs why at random times the camera would shut off on its own and then start working again. Even when it‚Äôs off the cable, the battery life is very short too.

column6: Don't even notice it on windshield
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
column14: I got another vehicle, so needed another dash cam. The one I put in before was a little too big and quite honestly just distracted me. Very compact, easy to wire down the trim, and I especially like that the screen goes off after just a few seconds. Surprisingly it does not drain my battery when I leave it plugged in all the time. Very nice setup, super great price, and I feel just a little bit more covered in my vehicle. Don't forget to get a micro SD card even though it came with one. I just like having a bigger one in there.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021
column14: This car camera is the best. I like this, it's better than another camera - I forgot its name, I threw it away because that is short-lived.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022

column6: Good dash cam, with a few minor issues
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
column14: A good dash cam that works. When stopped at the traffic signal, you can see the license plate of the car in front of you in both day and night.

column6: High quality dashcam with improved features
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2022
column14: I purchased this dashcam for a second vehicle. I have another Vantrue cam in our other car and have liked it, so went with this newer model. column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2021
column14: After carefully researching other cameras I went with this one 4K is a nice feature to have you can really tell the difference between my 1080p and this 4K the daytime capture looks amazing in 4K and the night mode looks very good too. Installation was very straight forward I am glad that a tool was included to tuck the wires away in your trim. It does not cause any harm to your vehicle. I read that a lot of people have issues with the app I have not I highly recommend that you long press the M button to put the camera in WIFI to connect to your device. You can also remove the micro SD card and upload it to your computer or laptop if you want to see the captured videos.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
column14: Pros:

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020

column6: stopped working after the first month

column6: Software and product is total garbage!!!!!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
column14: Not sure what the point of this camera even is. It claims to be automatic. But it doesn‚Äôt ever actually save drives. Just the route. Why would I buy a dash cam to save the route I took? column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
column14: My car cigarette lighter outlet is always powered on, so I was concerned about forgetting to turn off the camera and running the battery dead. Turns out, the camera will turn off on its own after a certain amount of inactivity. It also turns on and records on its own, but it usually doesn‚Äôt start until about 5 minutes of driving. Nexar says they‚Äôre working on that. So far, I‚Äôve remembered to turn it on most of the time.

column6: Great Phone Features and Hands-Off Approach
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
column14: My wife and I had a couple of dash cams and we hated having to take the memory card out and download the videos. We wanted something we never had to touch and would sync with our phones and this device covered every base. It does ask for a lot of phone permissions so if you're the type that values your privacy heavily this may give you some unease. However my wife and I are OK given the features and the hands-off nature. You can keep your phone in your pocket or purse and the camera will record no problem and if something was to happen you can go back and save a specific clip or it will also automatically record hard brakes or accidents.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
column14: I have had different dashboard camera's before. This one is the the most expensive one I bought so far and it has been worth every penny. As far as installation, it was very easy to stick it to my windshield with the suction cup. I loved that it came with cord clips to tie up the cord around your car. I spent a good 30 minutes stringing the cord throughout my windshield and under the passenger seat so the cord wasn't in the way when I am driving. As long as it has a power source, it turns on when the car turns on, making it very worry free.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
column14: This product is awesome and is great for anyone with a smart phone. Usually dash cams save all footage on a memory card but this one saves all footage on your phone making it really easy to access any footage you might want to check out. It‚Äôs easy to install and the wires are easy to hide. The quality is very good when it‚Äôs recording and your able to see the license plate of cars in front of you.

column6: I did a lot of research on these and this is a great option!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2019
column14: I just purchased this for a 20 hour road trip (20 hours each way yikes) coming up in a couple months. These are absolutely perfect for our needs and I would recommend them to anyone needing dvd players in the car for small children.  Our children (5 and 2) are completely silent anytime we're in the car now. It's blowing our minds.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019
column14: We purchased this item for our kids to use while on a long 8-hour drive.  It arrived today, the day before the trip, as scheduled.  Tested the item out the same day, and one screen played for less than an hour then went completely dark.  The DVD is still playing as we can still hear the audio, but no visible video.  Kids are disappointed and now we will have an 8-hour drive with no DVD player for them to use.  It's going back to Amazon.

column6: Great players! Worth the extra to play two different movies!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020
column14: These are great.  I bought them before a 7 hour drive with my 4 year old twins.  You can watch the same movie or different which is nice.  It comes with a car charger that can charge both units at the same time which is great.  Sound and picture quality are great too.  The only thing I should have taken into account are the buttons on the front of the units.  This would be fine for older kids to control it themselves but for younger kids this results in them kicking the buttons and turning off/fast forwarding/rewinding the movie while you're driving. Cue the whining and screaming that the movie isn't playing. Ugh oy vey.  Something to think about if your kids are younger.  Otherwise these are great and I look forward to using them for many road trips to come!!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
column14: This is my third set of travel DVD players, but first Wonnie product, and for the money it's a great product.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
column14: These worked out well for a recent road trip. Very easy to set up, and I appreciate I didn't need to use headrest adapters that slide on the prongs of the headrest like some other brands. The brackets were sturdy and didn't flop around the entire 3000 mile trip. The screens are bright enough to not get washed out, and they were large enough for comfortable viewing. The sound from the speakers can be a bit tinny, but that is really nitpicking at the details.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
column14: We had our first set for 11 months and the slave monitor quit working. So I emailed the seller and manufacturer and they gave me a full refund and I ordered a 2nd set! Well worth it! column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019
column14: The screens work good. I thought I would be using the cig lighter as the power source but my car has a 120v plug. My only recommendation would be to include a usb type pwr supply cable. Because of where the outputs are located  (right side on both slave and master), I installed the master on the left so the cables run more directly.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2019
column14: Update: a little over one year going strong! Units are STILL awesome!

column6: Great value! Good dual screen DVD player, converting movie files should be easier (lessons included)
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2020
column14: This is a really good value if it meets your requirements.  We really wanted a solution that had both TVs showing the same content, which narrows down your options greatly.  This can do it both for a DVD and for content from USB/SD card.  The TVs have more that adequate quality for backseat car viewing, and the headphones were of high sound quality than I expected.  They are a bit bulky, but they don't require any external packs besides AC power, so its a good tradeoff.  Hookup is very simple - one cable connects the TV, and one power cable.  It comes with both AC and DC/cigarette lighter versions.

column6: Great design questionable second screen possibly used?

column6: OVERALL a bad experience. EDIT - It gets worse.

EDIT 10-12-2020 - Due to COVID I was unable to have the shop replace my unit for they faulty one in a timely manner. column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2021
column14: I got this tv to upgrade from a old flip down tv in my camper van. HDMI inputs are great for Xbox or other connections. Very happy with the picture quality.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021
column14: There are so many of these screens to choose from out there and I really had a hard time narrowing it down.  I feel like most of the brands out there are all the same for the most part.  This set looks absolutely GREAT and when installed right look to be factory.  My issue is with the operating system.  It is buggy to say the least.  Disney+ will download through Apkpure (because Google Play basically is in operable) but will not play any sound.  Hulu freezes up on the login screen.  Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Paramount+ work fine.  Also the sound coming from the tablet when no headphones are plugged in is more than loud enough.  However, when using the headphone jack the sound is barley audible at max volume, I'm going to get some blue tooth headphones and see if they are any better.  It moves a little slow navigating the menus which I can live with, I just hate that this OS cannot operate better.  I really feel like with tech these days there should no issues having an OS that is like a phone or tablet, smooth and able to download just about any app.  This product really has the potential to be a 5 star review and in every SUV out there.  Ultimately if I didn't have the work installing these in our car I would probably send them back.  Unfortunately I cannot recommend this product but also not sure if there is a product out there might be better.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
column14: This camera is great for me. It's a small/compact dash camera with the ability to record both front and inside of cabin. I had a previous dual dash camera that I had to run the rear camera wire throughout the cars trim and it was a pain. I needed a new camera but I didn't want the hassle of running wires throughout a van. This fit the bill as far as features. High def 1080@30fps quality recording for both front and rear cameras, the front and rear cameras are built into one solid device, GPS and WI-FI, The Wi-Fi feature is so awesome to be able to watch recordings through the app instead of taking the camera out or the MicroSD card out to view the recordings. Infrared LED lights for night time recording of inside the vehicle, photograph mode, G-sensor, Motion detection, Parking mode, Fatigue Driving Alert (which sends a time alert that you can set from 1,2,4 hours to take a break), easy to install and easy to navigate through menus and settings.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
column14: I was looking for a dash cam, but didn't know where to start. After browsing for a while, I stumbled upon this one. I looked at all the features and thought the price was decent so I decided to get it a try. I am glad that I did get it. It was easy to set up and to get started I didn't have to open the instructions manual. I inserted an extra micro SD card that I had lying around, hooked up the USB cable, and it worked right away. It was pretty intuitive. After finally reading the instructions I saw that there is an app for it. I downloaded it and found it easy to use. The pictures and videos in this review were downloaded from the app to my phone. It was easy to do.  The video quality is pretty clear. It records both inside and outside at the same time. The sound quality is also pretty good, however I removed it from the video for privacy reasons. I saw some cams that are way more expensive but I have also saw that are cheaper. I don't know how good those cheap ones really are though. The only negative comment I have is that it doesn't come with the memory card. Maybe they can bump up the price $20 and include one in a future release. So far I definitely recommend this dash cam.

The memory card is included but I can buy a larger size one for sure. When I formatted the SD card and the system language is default to Chinese but I have read lots of reviews and watch videos people posts, I am sure it is possible to change to English setting. Just go through the setting menu and find the icon with an A, see photo, then you can I read Chinese but my family do not so I  so it is not an issue for me. I feel better with this gadget installed in my car. We are also going on a road trip and this could capture some of the scenery as well. It is a good purchase. I am thinking to get one for our other car as well. The only thing I would prefer is to have a different way of powering this.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2021
column14: Shipping took way longer than it should've for "Prime 2 day" it took like a week. But nots not the sellers fault. On top of that I had a little bit of trouble getting it to work with my Pioneer AVH310EX. I asked for help via the Amazon questions and the seller was very quick to respond with a 9 point list of things to look over. Sure enough, one of the points on the list stated "please do not use wire clamps"....which is what I had done. So I spliced the wires properly instead of doing it the lazy way. Added wire to the ground wire so I could put it in a better spot, and I had to try multiple rca inputs on my stereo (if you have an avh310ex, plug the rca into the brown plug, not the yellow) and then it finally worked! Picture looks just a little bit grainy but nothing worse than any oem camera I've seen on higher end vehicles. That being said, this camera is well worth the money. It has a strong sturdy build, which surprised me when I took it out of the box. It seems to be all metal, not some cheap plastic case like most cameras have.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022
column14: Not bad for the price. It works, except the settings seem to sometimes reset themselves if the unit turns off. Also, the wording on some of the settings can be confusing, and the settings themselves don't all seem to work. There is an auto power off mode that works, maybe 50 percent of the time. I have the unit plugged into a cigarette lighter, and sometimes the camera will just stay on forever, and sometimes it will turn off. If it turns off, I have to go back into the settings and reset a few things like the option to record sound and the date. I find it odd that this camera only turns off when it loses power. It should be set up to automatically turn off when no motion or vibration has been detected for a few minutes. Motion detection works very poorly; it will randomly stop detecting motion mid drive, thus stopping the recording, so I suggest turning that off. Overall, the basic functionality works, and the 2k front camera and 1080p rear camera record constantly; it's just that the extra settings are buggy. Also, the screw on the camera mount shreds easily and doesn't connect well to the base. This is definitely something you get for an older or spare vehicle.

column6: Product great, install might vary depending on Highlander Model
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
column14: First off, the fit and finish for the camera is great and looks like a factory option after you install it.  The problem I ran into was that things were not quite the same for my 2018 Highlander XLE and the Highlander that was shown in the install video from the manufacturer.  If you look at the pictures I've attached, my Highlander is the one with the tan dash.  Once I popped off the side panel, I was faced with  ridged metal plate that blocked my entry to feed the cable harness to the OBD2 port.  After some bending of the plastic and some minor cuts to my fingers on the sharp metal plate edges, I was able to squeeze the male OBD2 port into the hole.  Unfortunately, the path of least resistance for the harness places it in a "caged" off area under the dash.  There is literally a couple of tiny opening in which you can stick finger and devices in there to blindly fish the OBD2 port head.  It took 20 minutes of twisting and being mindful not to break any of the thin wires to get the fitting over to the OBD2 receptacle.  Then, when I connected it, I found the OBD2 receptacle was not attached to anything in my Toyota so it just pushed into an empty void under my dash.  Add another 10 minutes of trying to fish it out then stabilize it to plug the fitting in.  Finally success.  If I didn't run into these problems, it would have been a 10 minute install, tops.  Both software apps seem pretty janky but they work.  Now I have decent piece of mind that my wife will be driving around with a dash cam running in case she's involved in an accident.  Again, I highly recommend the camera itself, it was the install and Highlander that posed all the problems.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2017
column14: I drive a motor home all over the country and pull a trailer a lot so having a good back up camera image sent to the tablet computer mounted in the cab of my RV would give me a large clear image when hooking up the trailer and when backing the motor home in close quarters. This wifi transmitter was really quite simple to install. The three wires from the wifi unit are labeled and color coded. One bare red wire gets power (in my case from backup lights). The connector on the second red wire plugged right into  a connector from the $19 license plate bracket camera I bought at the same time and that wire passes power from the RV backup lights, thru the wifi unit into the back up camera.. The remaining yellow wire from the wifi plugs into a matching plug from the the camera and gets video signal from the camera to send out by wifi.. Slick and simple as can be. I downloaded the app for my android tablet which worked easily for me. Then with the RV in reverse  I  went into the tablets settings, selected wifi, identified the little backup camera wifi icon and hit connect. Bingo, a nice big color picture from behind the RV. An icon for the little wifi transmitter automatically showed up on my tablets home screen, so when I go into reverse and hit that icon within about 3 seconds the backup camera image fills the screen of my 10 inch tablet.The picture is not high definition. It is bright, very clear, has good color and i would call it highly satisfactory partly because of the large screen size.. I dont know the long term reliability so hesitated giving it a 5 star. Although this will be posted from Dusti Jones I'm  Bob her husband. Others have had problems with the app so I will mention that my tablet is a relatively recent Samsung Galaxy S about two years old (Android version 6.0.1). This review was written March 2017.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2017
column14: I thought this would be very cool. My phone is already mounted on my dash, so adding this and a camera gives me a backup camera with no extra screens. Yes, it works, and it does what it advertises, and setup was easy. If you are certain you want a backup camera that works like this, then buy it. However, a device that does what this device does is, by its nature, VERY impractical. Here's why: It makes its own WiFi, which is cool. But in order to use it you need to switch to that wifi. So, if you have wifi at home and jump into your car, then you have to start the car, wait about 20 seconds for the device's WiFi to start, open your Settings app, switch to the device's WiFi, then switch back to your home screen and launch the Camera app. So that's about a minute of work, all together. If you want to get in the car and back up right away with the aid of this device, that's not going to happen. Then, assuming you've done all of that, and you're on the road and you want to access any internet-enabled app, or if you use WiFi calling on your phone at home, you MUST turn off the phone's WiFi in order to use that app (or make a call if you use WiFi calling at home.) As a result, after having it for a week, I don't use it any more. I'll be returning it. In a nutshell, if after reading this it all still fits with how you use it, then consider this a 4-star rating (sometimes there's a lag in the image). But if you're going to use it in a fairly standard way, just get a dedicated backup camera and screen. You'll use it much more.

column6: Super suction mount and great camera
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2022
column14: There are a handful of videos on the internet showing the quality of the video recorded by this dash cam, so there is no need for me to elaborate here.  The GPS is fast to acquire a lock, the quality of the audio recording is super, and I like the use of a USB plug for connecting the power.  I have other cams that use a pin-type connector for power and found them to be very unreliable and prone to failure and/or falling out of the camera during off-road use.  Speaking of the USB power cable provided with the camera...it's a dandy!  It comes with both a 90-degree USB plug on one end and a 90-degree car power plug on the other with enough cable length to reach the back seat in a small SUV!  This model is furnished with a suction mount that is both small and easy to install.  It allows the camera to fit nicely between the windshield and the rearview mirror‚Ä¶assuming you don‚Äôt need to view the camera‚Äôs screen.  If you do want to view the screen, the handy suction mount will attach to just about any flat or slightly curved, smooth surface.  I'm just now getting familiar with the companion app that's installed on my iPhone, so I have only a couple of comments there.  The app was easy to install, easy to figure out what buttons did what and was helpful in adjusting the camera view whenever access to the screen on the camera was obscured (either by glare from the sunlight or by the rearview mirror).  My iPhone SE sometimes requires going to the WiFi Settings menu to coach it into connecting with the camera‚Ä¶I have several different Drive Cams.  In addition to just watch what‚Äôs being recorded on the iPhone, you can also use the app to download and view recorded data without having to remove the memory chip from the camera.  Unfortunately, there are several different versions of the camera‚Äôs internal firmware that are floating around.  An older version doesn‚Äôt allow playing back recorded videos and photos on the camera screen, while newer versions do.  You can check with Redtigre to see if an update is available.  One final note:  I have contacted the folks at Redtiger several times and found them to be both very helpful and extremely fast to respond.  Because of the quality of this dash cam, combined with their customer service, I give them five stars!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
column14: This camera is great for me. It's a small/compact dash camera with the ability to record both front and inside of cabin. I had a previous dual dash camera that I had to run the rear camera wire throughout the cars trim and it was a pain. I needed a new camera but I didn't want the hassle of running wires throughout a van. This fit the bill as far as features. High def 1080@30fps quality recording for both front and rear cameras, the front and rear cameras are built into one solid device, GPS and WI-FI, The Wi-Fi feature is so awesome to be able to watch recordings through the app instead of taking the camera out or the MicroSD card out to view the recordings. Infrared LED lights for night time recording of inside the vehicle, photograph mode, G-sensor, Motion detection, Parking mode, Fatigue Driving Alert (which sends a time alert that you can set from 1,2,4 hours to take a break), easy to install and easy to navigate through menus and settings.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
column14: I was looking for a dash cam, but didn't know where to start. After browsing for a while, I stumbled upon this one. I looked at all the features and thought the price was decent so I decided to get it a try. I am glad that I did get it. It was easy to set up and to get started I didn't have to open the instructions manual. I inserted an extra micro SD card that I had lying around, hooked up the USB cable, and it worked right away. It was pretty intuitive. After finally reading the instructions I saw that there is an app for it. I downloaded it and found it easy to use. The pictures and videos in this review were downloaded from the app to my phone. It was easy to do.  The video quality is pretty clear. It records both inside and outside at the same time. The sound quality is also pretty good, however I removed it from the video for privacy reasons. I saw some cams that are way more expensive but I have also saw that are cheaper. I don't know how good those cheap ones really are though. The only negative comment I have is that it doesn't come with the memory card. Maybe they can bump up the price $20 and include one in a future release. So far I definitely recommend this dash cam.

To add insult to injury, several parts were defective. One of the brackets was defective and I had to carve out (using an exact knife) the threads on the mounting bracket. The sunvisor does not fit perfectly in the clip. It's really annoying. Overall, if I were to go back in time I would have purchased a different visor. I get that the brackets may not match or line up, but the parts were defective. Although the sunvisor works and looks pretty good in my car, I really feel this item deserves one star nonetheless.

column6: Very good quality in almost every respect
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021
column14: This camera system is of very good quality in almost every respect.  The packaging, the user manual, the ease of use, the user interface, the image quality,  the hardware and the software are all very good.  I only had one minor complaint...the rear facing camera is designed to be mounted under a surface, and not on top of one.  I wanted to install the rear facing camera on the roof of my van.  Doing so resulted in the image being up-side-down.  The software does not allow for flipping the image.  I contacted customer support via email and they responded promptly telling me that the image cannot be flipped.
